text: Our first claim wasn't even addressed for nearly a month,  then when it was,  it was denied because they didn't have the prior year of medical records.  This claim was for our puppy who at the time was 7 months old.  We had ALL records from 2 days after we brought her home and every visit since.  She has never missed an appointment and only seen one vet. We are very meticulous about the care of our pets.  STILL. after pointing out that we couldn't possibly have a prior year of records for a 7 month old puppy and submitting every document we had, And having the vet do the same.  Nothing,  for another month.  Then finally they denied the claim for pre existing condition because her ears had been cleaned on a prior visit and that was what the claim was for,  she had an ear infection.  She is fine now by the way.  So there's proof that they rubber stamp claim denial without even looking at how old the dog is.  But it's no different than any other insurance company for people or pets.
title: Rubber stamp claim denial coming right up!

text: Probably the worst insurance company I’ve ever dealt with. You need to pay for every expense upfront and then they make you submit a claim for each expense but then repeatedly reject and delay so they never have to pay you out. They also claim to reimburse 90% but I’ve never received more than about 40% so I don’t even know what I’m paying for. Additionally, they ask for the same exact documentation EVERY TIME which makes no sense because if I already submitted it SEVERAL times why do I need to submit it again?! They also completely ignore key information such as the date we brought our pup home and then ask for information we clearly could not have based on that. Finally, they have asked us to reach out to previous vets for their notes? Documentation we don’t easily have access to and a previous vet has absolutely zero willingness to provide so just another way for them to prolong the process and ultimately reject our claims. Wildly unhelpful and inconvenient I will likely cancel my policy.
title: Probably the worst insurance company…

text:
Imagine buying your first home. You love it, and are so excited to have finally bought a house. You can’t wait to live the life you’ve always envisioned for yourself!

No imagine that after 4 months your basement floods due to a category 5 hurricane. Your insurance company tells you “sorry, Joe. But we notice here you had a sink in the bathroom in your basement. Sinks contain water, and water is a sure sign of flooding. Because your basement showed signs of water, we aren’t going to help you save your dream house. Don’t worry, knowing your house floods we will only increase your premiums 50%. Take care :)” 

This is what paying for Fetch Insurance is like. 

Take a few bills each paycheque and set it aside. You’ll do much better.
title: A Heartwarming Story

text:
Fetch Pet has Provided Amazing customer service, Easy process, and the feeling of reassurance that if there is an emergency you don't have to worry about how you're going to pay for it. 
My dog Mallory was overall healthy her entire life and just recently in her teens we experienced more vet visits that were extremely costly. I can't imagine not having Pet insurance, last year we even maxed out our policy with visits and when the renewal came, I was surprised to see that it wasn't much more than the previous year even with all the claims. When she passed in March they paid the claim and without even being asked cancelled the policy and refunded the pro rated difference of the policy. When I called in to check that everything was all set (because the process seemed so almost too easy) Kathryn the representative was so sweet really listening to me talk about my dog who just passed away. I have never had a negative experience, and everything was very easy on the online portal. I can't say enough good things about this company. 

IF your wondering if you should buy pet insurance, From my experience with a ill senior dog After witnessing so many people in the Emergency Rooms putting their pets to sleep because they couldn't afford the cost of surgery's, treatment etc., PLEASE GET YOUR PET INSURANCE. I am so relived I never had to make that decision and my decision to lay her to rest was because we had no more options and not due to a vet expense.

text: No contact for questions. The refund took 2 weeks longer than the plan described, which is less of an issue. My problem is that there is no clear way to contact/follow-up. Normally, with pet or human insurance, the deductible is subrtracted from the total, then the co-insurance is calculated. In my claim, FetchPet calculated the co-insurance from the overall total, then subtracted the deductible. This resulted in me receiving ~$205 instead of ~$264. I understand their goal is to minimize how much I am re-imbursed, but I've never seen insurance calculated like this before - I work in healthcare.
title: No Contact for Follow-Up & Questionable Calculations

text: I read a recent review here that Fetch raised rates $300 a year. I don't know what percent of their policy that is, but I was raised 38% this year and last year it was close to 40%. I have had to make changes in the coverages to make it affordable. I read a review here suggesting saving your money and paying the bills as you go along. That is a great idea!  I wish I had done a very long time ago. It makes a lot of sense. If you are good with budgeting, it makes sense because pet insurance is not a good investment. I've spent tens of thousands of money on this pet insurance. If I had saved the money and paid the costs from my bank account, I would now have at least $15k extra in the bank. (I did the math.) I am tempted to wing it and pay as I go along. I could afford it decades ago for a dog who lived to 16 and I had no pet insurance back then, and I wasn't making a lot of money. I survived financially. This insurance for 2 dogs costs me annually more than 3 vehicles with full coverage and zero claims on my auto policy. I can put the money into a CD. They do process claims in a timely manner, but they charge $3.50 per pet per transaction each time they charge for the policy payment. (That's 2 transactions for me per quarter for my 2 dogs, $28 a year.) Other companies are charging $2 for one transaction because they combine the policies in one single charge. The fee equates to less for me to be billed monthly somewhere else than to be billed quarterly with Fetch. Not for nothing, but why would Fetch's charges be so much higher when their employees have been working from home since at least covid? There is barely any overhead. They don't have to rent or buy and office building, pay for heat and A/C, pay cleaning people, etc. What constitutes their fees and exorbitant increases? Come on. I do have to credit Katie for correcting misinformation I got from someone else there (Lisa) who (twice) told me the fee was $5 per dog, saying it would be $40 total to be billed quarterly and $120 total to be billed monthly. The increases have been huge for years. They changed one of my dogs to their new policy with an annual deductible and didn't change my other, yet they are the same age and were insured the same day from the start. It doesn't make sense. I've had my policies for 10 years. There is no loyalty discount.
title: Fetch Pet is greedy -- nothing like old PetPlan

text: It is hard to decide which pet insurance to chose.  Once you pick one you can never leave because everthing that has happened to your pet is now a pre existing condition.  Which means no other pet insurance will cover your pet. So I talked to 6 different companies and chose Fetch.  Fetch had all the items I thought I needed for my new puppy. Fetch has a easy app to put all you documents on and they pay very quickly. But I was told they pay for all puppy shots. But as we all know puppys get 3 shots of DAPP.  Fetch only pays for one of each vaccine, so I had to pay for the other two.  Which is not what I was told by the sales people.  I asked this question two times to make sure they would pay for all puppy vaccines.  I will write another review if another loop hole comes up, but needless to say I am disappointed in the bait and switch.
title: Puppy policy

text: For as much as it costs, I would think more would be covered. I think I paid close to $600 for pet insurance for both of my cats, and out of my $6-7,000 vet bills over the course of a couple years, fetch reimbursed me for maybe $100 because the deductible is fairly high and both of my cats had health concerns during their waiting period that wouldn’t get covered. Despite their claims that every adult tooth would be covered, if your animal has periodontal disease that predates their coverage period, they will cover none of it. I cancelled it after 2-3 years, absolutely not worth paying for. I’d rather put what I’d spend on pet insurance in a savings account for emergencies. On top of it, when they told me they’d cancelled it they didn’t, and charged me for an additional period so I had to call and cancel again.

text:
We got fetch pet insurance when we adopted our two kittens from the SPCA.
They were sent home with amoxicillin for a minor upper respiratory infection that is common in adoption agencies due to crowded conditions. These symptoms of  sneezing, runny nose, and eyes did not go away. After many additional visits to Vet and testing, we found that they have feline herpes. This is something that they were born with. I was thankful that we had the fetch pet insurance for help paying for some of these bills. But… after much deliberation, it was decided that, no, nothing would be covered because this is a “pre-existing condition”. this is just not right, when we adopted these cats, this was not known. They were born with Feline Herpes contracted from their mother. My question is, how far back does a preexisting condition go???!

For these reasons, I would  not  recommend this pet insurance!!!
title: Uncovered claims

text:
In 2017, I became a policyholder under the provision of pet insurance for my Yorkshire Terrier, opting for the plan with unlimited coverage, a 90% reimbursement rate, and an annual deductible of $150. Year by year, I have endured an increasing premium payment, averaging an 8% increase annually straight from 2017 through 2022. Please see the detailed analysis below:
2017: $434.52
2018: $456.51 (5% increase)
2019: $519.57 (12% increase)
2020: $597.32 (13% increase)
2021: $649.12 (8% increase)
2022: $732.21 (11% increase)
2023: $1,064.28 (31% increase)
2024: $1,775.92 (40% increase)
The subsequent years showed an alarming increase after Petplan attempted to modify my coverage in 2022. A proposed restriction on my annual cover to $5K was introduced, coupled with a reduced reimbursement rate of 80% and an increased deductible of $500.
I called in to discuss my plan on 02/01/24 at 12:39 PM and spoke with Jordan. His tone and manner were cold, callous, and very condescending. He talked down to me and made me feel bad for choosing to provide my pet with the highest level of coverage from the beginning. He offered unreasonable downgrades and suggested I cancel my service. Refusing such alterations, I faced an undeserved punishment of increasing rates by 30% and 40% in the years 2023 and 2024, respectively. Essentially, feeling strong-armed into reducing my coverage or canceling my policy. 
According to the "Healthy Paws Cost of Pet Care Report" by Canine Journal, the average annual cost of pet insurance in New Jersey for a dog with unlimited coverage is $672. When compared with the $1775.92 price tag Petplan has levied upon me, this constitutes a 59% increase, which is preposterous. The National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) has regulations in place requiring insurance companies to publicly explain any rate increase of 15% or more before its implementation, which Petplan is unable to do.
I do not have a history of filing claims. My pet has all his annual check-ups, necessary vaccinations, and preventative care, and raising my rates this high with no just cause appears deceptive. PetPlan is not basing my rates on the actual cost of insurance in NJ, my car, homeowners and medical insurance did not increase by 59% over the 2 years. Petplan's inability to provide a reasonable justification for this egregious 59% rate increase is an unethical practice of price gouging.
title: PRICE GOUGING

text:
I having pet insurance is new for me.
You do get responses but not via a phone call. I feel strongly that you should be able to talk to someone about questions.
It's good customer service.

There was some confusion over how my bills were being handled.
In the end it worked out well.
It was a lot of work on my end.
More time is needed to tell if it will be a good fit for me. 
I recently had to put my 15 yr old dog down and she did have some health issues..I visited a rescue and after meeting a puppy of 3 months I decided to Adopt.
Amanda M. spoke about the insurance, had a pamphlet, mentioned their would be a discount given if I purchased it as well as a portion that went to the facility.
I didn't sign up right there.
I had 24 hours to decide.
I could add to a wellness package, change my deductible, etc.
Puppies need several wellness visits and many vaccines. So that part isn't great.
Example two Lyme boosters, two DHPP, two DHLPP, two Lyme, two Canine influenza and so on. 
Your payout is very limited that first year if you have a puppy 
The illness/ Injury package doesn't go into effect right away. You have to meet your deductible first.

You can cancel at anytime.
What I hope is that I at least get my monthly payout back by turning in receipts.
All of these visits are expensive and in top your paying for insurance as well.
The cap on wellness is $500 a year.

It's great if you take your dog once for a wellness with vaccinations, Heart guard/ flea and tick, urine, heartworm test etc. 

I'll give it 4 stars but time is needed to tell.
title: First time having pet insurance and didn't compare

text:
My dog Bella passed away on Feb 6 2024 ,I submitted a claim to Fetch for her Euthanasia etc ., 

Feb 16 said claim was in review 

Feb 19 received email from Fetch wanting all information from VCA medical records ,for what reason ? they were not the vet who put her down. I had already submitted the medical notes with invoice the day she passed away from my vet.
 
I called them on Feb 19 was shocked why they needed notes from VCA spoke with Johnny and he said he would take care of calling VCA for me,. What does VCA have to do with this ? it was my other vet who had put Bella my dog down and I had already sent in the medical notes plus details on Feb 6 as it was. 

Feb 28,received email from Fetch saying they do not have any information yet from me .. I then had  VCA re send me all 39 pages of medical notes from her seizures and situation.

I tried uploading it again and it said I could not submit it,I then called fetch again on Feb 28 and they said they had received everything again on Feb 21 and how things are now resolved, 

March 13,received email from fetch how my claim was approved but I have not met the deductible. 
I had enough of the drama and emailed Johnny and told him again what happened and he again cancelled my account again for the 2nd time.

After everything I had been through with the loss of my dog Bella,I am heart broken and devastated and traumatised by what happened as she only just turned 3 and then having to deal with Fetch insurance and sending them in over 39 pages on her medical conditions just for her Euthanasia !! when VCA had nothing to do with the euthanasia ,I was shocked by how I got treated by fetch insurance and will never deal with them again. I had to continue to go through this heart breaking situation daily and shocked to why fetch would continue to put me through this.

I have had many dogs in my life and have never experienced something so insensitive as what i went through with Fetch over a claim for my dogs euthanasia on Feb 6 2024.. 

I wanted to thank Johnny as he was very kind to me. How ever ,what the claims department had put me through its not forgivable at all. They truly dont care about your animals, only getting money from you and to put you through a claim over a euthanasia of your animal then asking for information that has nothing to do with it for no reason at all then putting me through this from Feb 6 2024-until March 13 is not acceptable while I am still healing from my beloved dog who was my world ,my everything and best friend who is now gone forever. Never have I ever experienced anything like this from any other pet  insurance companies I had dealt with in the past for my animals .



Jeni Cousins
title: My dog Bella passed away on Feb 6 2024…

text: TERRIBLE SCAM! OVERPRICED and USELESS! DO NOT waste your money and time please! JUST DONT! They do not cover anything! Not only they do not return calls forever, but their management is useless and Rude!!! I had to “fetch” so they can review my claims. Until it was too late, and they conveniently told me the claim review period was over.  And, even then I was told the plan wouldn’t cover it. So what does it cover???? Managment of the company is ignorant to the clients. They will not help you. Even customer care person was MORE understanding than the manager. He clearly said “No” to any of my questions. For questions why their company did not return the calls he lied to me that they did and I did not pick up the phone - so why didn’t you leave a voicemail??? Isn’t it a sensible thing to do to leave a voice message with the contact so your client can call you back?! So it’s a total lie. He did not call me. text: I’ve had fetch over a year, paid them every month just like I was supposed to and then I had a change and needed to cancel the policy. I did that through the app on January 15 I believe, but it did not go through and I did not notice until March 4 which happened to be my birthday, I noticed that there was actually two charges on there so I called Fetch and explained to them that this was supposed to have been canceled that I knew I couldn’t get February back but if we could please do something about March and they did, she said that she sent a ticket to accounting so that I could get refunded for the payment that was taken on the second and on 4 March , then she sent me an email verifying that the account was closed about three hours later I received an additional debit from my account from Fetch, so I called Fetch again, and they told me that it was a glitch, and that they have never seen anything like it, and that they were going to expedite a ticket to IT , they could not, however give me an answer as to if this was definitely not going to happen again, so I called my bank and my bank stop those charges and ended up having to cancel my debit card. Issue me a new one and I had to pay to have it expedited to me within 24 to 48 hours but the very next day Fetch debited my account again apparently they’re saying it was done through a digital wallet, that I’m not sure of, but I have now been debited a total of five times, Fetch really doesn’t know what’s going on my bank of course is having to wait until the pending charges actually go through so that they can turn around and reverse the charges but here’s my thing, this all seems very illegal, because why is a company holding onto my financial information and charging me days after they verified not once, but twice that the account was closed ? This seems super illegal and I’m very unhappy and I’m very confused as to how any of this is even happening.
title: They have debited my bank 5 times

text: I signed up for Fetch 7/22.  In January this year, I took Winnie to the vet.  He was admitted to the hospital where he stayed for 4 days. They needed bills from vet services for the prior year; explaining he had none, she assured me the claim would be processed within 7 days.  It was just a couple.  The two claims since were paid within a few days.  I am thrilled I purchased Fetch.  Only glitch was Winnie's lack of vet visits, which was quickly noted by customer service.  Filing claims is easy, receiving reimbursement quick.  I highly recommend Fetch.

text:
Buyer Beware: if you need insurance for a one time, unexpected accident this company is okay. But as soon as there is an ongoing medical condition Fetch will spike your premiums and lower pet coverage until it’s more expensive to have their insurance than pay for your dog’s treatment out of pocket. 

I had this insurance (previously PetPlan) since my now 13yo cocker mix was a perfectly healthy puppy. Therefore, everything was technically covered. When he had a couple small accidents, it was all reimbursed appropriately. However, as soon as my senior dog developed an aging lung condition and small heart murmur that requires expensive lifetime medication (still a very happy and active pup)… they made coverage completely unaffordable (3x the cost of his medication). When I called, a Fetch representative outright admitted that when pet payouts start to regularly exceed premiums and your deductible, this is what they do to make back the cost.
title: Buyer Beware

text:
If I could give them zero stars I would. Fetch was great until it wasn’t. They don’t actually care about your pets so don’t be fooled by their messaging like I was. They will decrease your policy to their  highest deductible and to the lowest co-insurance coverage with no warning or explanation. You will have to fight for the reason behind the change. They won’t even give you policy options like it states in your renewal email. It is a take the lousy offer or just leave. 

Pet insurance companies know that if you start using the pet insurance then you are stuck if you want coverage for your pet. Everything becomes pre-existing. It is so easy for them to screw you over and they enjoy doing it. I was more than happy to pay more money for the policy I had. I was even expecting the premium to go up. I was planning on paying it. I wasn’t expecting them to raise my deductible, lower my co-insurance, and lower the premium. None of this makes sense.

What is the point of being a loyal customer if they just take away the policy you’ve been paying for. You had a loyal paying customer that you have now screwed over and proven that you actually don’t care about animals and their owners at all. The customer service is so awful. I used to recommend so many people to this company but never again. The fact that I have talked to multiple that said we can’t help you. We aren’t going to do anything or help you. What happened to good customer service? I need a company to rely for my pets needs and this one just isn’t it.

Please, whatever you decide to do, find a better company for your pets. I miss Petplan. They were a great company. It sucks that Fetch bought them. I’ve had nothing but issues with Fetch.
title: If I could give them zero stars I…

text:
Talked to Fetch rep Samantha Jenkins  today to ask about the large increase in my premiums from the year before. She did a really good job in explaining the reasons for the large increase. 
1- My pet was now in a higher rate category due to her age.
2-Because I had made several claims over the past year I had lost some of the discounts that I had previously received due to being claims free.
3-There was also a rate increase due to a lot of claims being made with the type of breed of dog I have.
I was so pleased that she took the time to answer the questions I had and also did not make me feel rushed so she could answer another call. 
 HERE IS ANOTHER REASON I AM PLEASED WITH FETCH AS MY PET INSURANCE COMPANY.
About 2 years ago I realized that I had incorrectly reported my dog as being a purebred when she was actually a mixed breed. Note! There is a large difference in premiums then. At least that was in my case.
So what Fetch did for me is that they refunded me the difference for that year and also for the prior years overpayment. This was so unexpected but appreciated especially since it was an error on my part. The refunds of the premiums were about $500 for each of the 2 years. 
I would also say that any claims I've had have been hassle free.
It's all about reading and understanding you contract. 
Will definitely continue using Fetch as my pet insurance company
title: Fetch Pet Insurance Company

text: I decided to try Fetch when I needed to find a new plan for my dog. Now that I've had to submit a claim, I'm finding out how terrible this organization is. The subscriber portal is difficult to navigate and only has the bare minimum of options. I uploaded my pet's historical medical records twice because I couldn't tell if the upload was successful the first time, and there is no menu option to see your documents. Now, I'm still waiting for a claim to be processed. I waited 2 weeks and then get a request for my dog's historical medical records! I uploaded AGAIN, and I am still waiting. The portal only has 2 options for customer support - an AI bot with preset topics and an email address. I went with email and have yet to receive a response. Not only do I pay more per month for this policy, the annual limit is lower and the reimbursement percentage is lower than the policy I have on my other dog with Figo. I only signed up for a different insurance because at the time I had no experience with submitting a claim with Figo. Since then, I've had to submit claims to Figo and had no problems. I'm very disappointed that The Dodo promotes this insurance plan, and now that my dog is having issues, I feel like I am stuck, since all other insurance companies will say he has "pre-existing conditions."
title: Terrible support

text:
It's really unfortunate my pet became ill shortly after I switched insurance providers, essentially disqualifying him from all future claims. I'm mainly to blame for not reading the fine print and keeping my old policy during the waiting period (if that's allowed), but here's what I could have reasonably expected.
1. A shorter review period: It took over two weeks to hear back when the date alone should have resulted in a denial of the claim in an automated way.
2. Clearer disclosure of terms: The policy effective date isn't when policy coverage actually starts. It starts 15 days following. For joint related issues it starts 6 months following. I put in a lot of time to put the claim documentation together and didn't expect to be over 4000 dollars behind after waiting. Ideally the portal shouldn't have even let me submit. There should also be an initial option selection for joint health related claims when filing within 6 months of signup where the portal automatically denies the claim. At the very least that information should be presented in a clear way upon sign-up.

Given their response to my inquiry, any clinical symptom during the waiting period can be associated with any later health condition, disqualifying coverage. In my case, my pet having an upset stomach and potential immune condition or arthritis got grouped into a health condition that can overlap with just about anything later.

"A pre-existing condition is any medical condition which first occurred or showed clinical signs before the effective date of your policy or during the 15-day waiting period. (By "clinical signs," we mean any changes in your pet's normal healthy state, bodily functions or behavior.)"
title: The Fine Print

text:
Kyann was fantastic.  She was informative, courteous, and patient with my questions.  Thank you for having such a valuable employee.

Only one issue, I discovered after our call that my premium went from $40 to $54 on my pet Chase.
This was not mentioned to me during out phone call.  I am concerned.
title: Kyann was fantastic

text: I had hoped I would never need pet insurance in my lifetime. After losing my red heeler who was a service animal in October, I was hesitant but got a new dog in November to be a new service animal as I suffer from PTSD from work. Unfortunately he has hookworms that are being very resistant to the medication. He was anemic as a result and he's had complications. I had gotten Fetch during a Black Friday special after comparing them to other insurances and reading the reviews. I must say they have delivered 100%. So far I have gotten all the money I have spent on the insurance plus more back. Without this assistance, it would have been probably impossible for me to keep this dog healthy, which would be criminal. I cannot thank fetch enough for coming through and for having this. Insurance companies can't exist without some profit and I know I'm not adding to that profit but yet they are supporting me.
title: I know people worry about the validity of pet insurance, but I can tell you from first-hand experience fetch is the real deal.

text:
Sammy (my dog) turned 5 this year so I got her insurance. She's never had a written health concern besides "grade 1 mild tartar on her teeth" two years ago. This means they're dirty enough to notice, but not out of the norm, and not enough of a problem to fix. Basically normal wear and tear.

The other day she chipped her tooth playing, so I took her to the vet. Fetch would not cover that visit, and would not cover the procedure the vet recommended because a chipped tooth is "related" to dirty teeth... 
I spoke to customer service who defended the decision to not cover the procedure because the vet wanted to clean her teeth during the procedure to have a better view. Customer service thought it was weird that Fetch wouldn't cover the visit though, so customer service resubmitted the claim. I got an email the next day informing me it was still denied.

I chose Fetch because they covered teeth. It was expensive, and the monthly cost was more than triple what they've reimbursed me for, but I figured it would come in handy if something like a chipped tooth ever happened. I underestimated their greed and apathy. Don't make the same mistake I did.

If I could do it again, I would've chosen Nationwide. They would also prioritize profit over their customers and pets, but it would have been cheaper at least.

I immediately cancelled my Fetch insurance plan, and will never recommend them.
title: They'll treat anything as "related" to pre-existing conditions

text: Two years ago, we adopted the sweetest kitty who immediately became an essential member of our family. We’d never had pet insurance before but, on a friend’s enthusiastic endorsement of Fetch, figured it might be a good idea. It was the best idea: our young cat turned out to have major unforeseen & rare respiratory issues. Every vet appointment we go to, knowing we have Fetch on our side has been an enormous relief. We don’t dread when they give us an estimate; we don’t have to choose between getting our sweet girl the vet care she needs or keeping a roof over our heads. Fetch’s claims submission is straight-forward & simple - so simple, the first few times we used it I was anxious at how little we had to do, but the seamless experience quickly put me at ease. Just get the medical notes & invoice from your vet, & Fetch processes the coverage within the week. Fetch’s quick, thorough responsiveness has been a literal lifesaver for our cat, & a financial lifesaver for her humans. We’d never had pet insurance before Fetch. Now we’d never again have a pet without Fetch on our family’s team.
title: First-Time Pet Insurance, Now Fetch Forever!

We decided to enroll in Fetch Pet Insurance to provide us with peace of mind for our two cats in early 2023. In December 2023, our youngest cat, who had never experienced health issues, had a urinary tract obstruction. This led to a stressful and scary 5-day stay in the ER, and ultimately required a perineal urethrostomy (PU) surgery to save his life.

The process of signing up with Fetch was seamless, thanks to the agent who provided detailed instructions on setting up our account. This preparation made it easy for us to submit a claim, ensuring a smooth process. Following the payment of the bill, we submitted the claim and received confirmation from Fetch two weeks later, stating that the claim was covered in accordance with our policy.

Our interaction with Fetch Pet Insurance has been exceptionally positive. We are grateful for the smooth claim process and the confirmation (received within 2 weeks) that Fetch covered our claim according to our policy. Overall, Fetch has proven to be a reliable choice for our pet insurance needs.

text:
The vet said my older cat needed some major dental work. The price she quoted seemed so outrageously high, I was sure it wouldn’t be covered. I submitted a preauthorization, which was approved. Fetch covered everything, from the lab work to the x-rays and anesthesiologist. Kitty had two teeth pulled and is doing great! 

Fetch kept me informed of my claim’s status throughout the process and paid up promptly per my policy. Between this  claim and my other cat, the $30k kitty, who maxed out his policy limits two years in a row, I’m very pleased with Fetch and highly recommend them. I’ve insured my cats with them since 2010. They are easy to work with, the app is easy to use, and customer service reps are always pleasant and helpful, whether by phone or by text.
title: Older cat’s dental claim

text:
I have another policy with my older two dogs with a different company. I decided to look for a new company to compare prices. When I found fetch I decided to try them as the price point made more sense.  I have in general experienced a lot of differences with the policy itself with things that you would assume would be standard across insurance companies. 
1. Pre approvals on quotes ( not just conditions) 
2. The length of time it takes to process the claim is very long. 
3. When ever I ask a question about the policy I never get a straight answer. Eg. please provide an eg of a supplement that’s recommended by vet that helps a medical condition covered under my policy …as the food is recommended by my vet and apparently not covered… and they won’t provide an example.
4. Yearly deductible is higher than my other dogs. 

These are all things my other company does with my other dogs. 

I will likely be considering other insurance companies when the time comes unless these things were addressed unfortunately.
title: Policy comparisons against other companies

text:
I don't have words to thank Fetch Insurance enough. They have been absolutely amazing helping me through the process while my 9 year old Siamese Mila was diagnosed with an aggressive cancer. I had the policy for years but it was the first time using it. They were wonderful guiding me, supporting me, and helping me while going through the worse days from October 2023 to January 1, 2024, the day Mila passed. Thank You THANK YOU THANK YOU.
Tattianna Smith has been great today providing me with support while I'm still suffering so much the lost of my companion. Thank you. You guys are all great.
title: BEST PET INSURANCE - HANDS DOWN

text:
Raises premiums EXPONENTIALLY once your dog is in their mid-range.

Fetch needs to review the competitors pricing and match up accordingly. In the last 5 years I have had this insurance, my premium went up from $300 to $1700!! This is six times the original premium and I never even had a claim in the first three years! Over the years they increased, doubled my premium, I never said anything but the most recent increase in premium went up another $700 straight away. 

$1700 annually plus tax for a $5000 coverage and 80% coverage is extremely low and unacceptable. Other insurance companies cover $10,000 to $20,000 for ~$1200 premium for the same dog.
Almost feels like a rip off at this point because they think you cant move. When you call the customer service to talk about the premium, they have an attitude so its pointless. There is no solution outside of just cancelling or continuing to pay really. 

I would recommend to shop around. I am certainly not going with Fetch if and when I am looking for another insurance provider.
title: Raises premiums EXPONENTIALLY once your…

text: The worse pet insurance ever. I signed up for insurance for my cat when she was 15 because she was healthy and I just adopted another cat from APL who suggested I try fetch pet insurance. I thought if APL is recommending it maybe it’s good. Huge mistake. I should have researched it first. They claim they take care of claims within 2 weeks. Big lie. They take easily 3-4 weeks then always claim they need more info. You send the info again and it takes another 2-3 weeks. Then I was denied for a claim. My cat went to a specialist that was recommended by oncology . She had a colonoscopy with biopsy that showed small cell lymphoma of intestines. I was denied the claim bc fetch claimed my cat had prior weight loss which was incorrect. All of her exams that clearly had the weight stated was over 10 pounds until Oct 30, 2023 when it showed over 8 pounds. This was a NEW weight loss not discovered until well after signing on with fetch. I cancelled the insurance. It’s just to stressful dealing with them as they do anything to stall the claim and not refund you but they sure are quick to take your money when it’s due every 3 months. I don’t even think the insurance is worth it. Since my cat was older ( 15 years ) when I got this her premium was 500 every 3 months .  Then it only paid 80 percent after 400 deductible and maximum 5,000 a year. When you think about it it doesn’t really cover that much. I would be paying 2 grand a year to cover her anyways and the headache of them delaying the claims and delaying and acting like they don’t have everyhing when they do then not paying attention to the actual dr notes ( if they looked at my cats actual weight for every appointment) they would have clearly seen her weight loss was not discovered until well after the insurance kicked in. I dropped them. I know to NOT use them for any future pets. Good luck with those of you who use this mess of a company
title: The worse pet insurance ever

text:
What I liked about Fetch so far is anytime I've phoned I was always able to talk to someone knowledgeable to help me understand  my policy which I find very convoluted and confusing about what is covered and what isn't.
They have also been very kind and courteous 
Understanding your policy is important so you know what you're actually responsible to pay for.
The first 6 years I didn't use it much as our cat has been pretty healthy but lately she has had some issues that required some medical attention.
Having said that there is some procedures that she needs done so it was nice to have a policy in place to help share the costs.
Pet insurance can be quite expensive but so can an emergency trip to the vet.
Pets are just like people and can have unexpected health issues at any time without warning.
Sometimes you don't think about that when you first bring your new pet home.
Fetch has been pretty good. Submit the claim form which goes in for a review and once it's completed and accepted you can have the money directly deposited into your account.
The review time process is reasonable and you get constant updates as to the status of your claim.
So far I'm pleased with the customer care and service they provide.

text: I was happy with Fetch when I first got it. It was affordable and I felt good knowing my dogs were covered. My dogs are (just turned) 4 and (almost) 3. Their premiums have doubled since I got them insured. They were insured since almost day 1 and prices have only gone up and up and up. They don't give any discount for adding a second pet and they are not simple to deal with when submitting a claim. They will try to relate ANYTHING to a pre-existing condition. My dog had a cough as a puppy and they tried to tell me her pink eye was pre-existing from the cough over a year prior. I had to fight to get $30 eye drops covered. The app glitches often and reimbursement is slow. I have contacted them already about all of these things and their response took weeks and was basically just excuses why. Including the area I live in, just like car insurance. So no matter how well I take care of my pet, if I live somewhere they deem more hazardous, they will charge me more. Like they assume if I live in a city I'm going to let my dogs play in traffic. When I first signed up they said the premium increased in accordance with yearly vet increases. This is so NOT the case. My insurance is so much now, that it would be cheaper to just pay their bills outright at the vet. Fetch does not provide more or better service for the price increases either. I would definitely do things differently next time. If my insurance continues on this trajectory I would have been WAY better off setting monthly money aside for any illness or emergencies they may have. Insurance is not affordable for the average person. It would be nice if a company that actually cared about pets' being well being existed in Canada. Right now it's just as cash grab tugging at our love for our pets.
title: Raise Prices Every Year

text:
I have had both my cats on insurance since they were just over a year old, and the rates were very reasonable! In the last year, I have had to make 1 claim for each of them, and I was extremely pleased that in both situations I did not encounter any difficulties or surprises! In both situations, the instructions about the documents I needed to provide were very clear, and I received all the money I expected back in both situations. I'm so glad I jumped on insurance while they were young, because this year one of my cats developed a very fast tooth infection that spread through her whole mouth, and required an extensive dental surgery (which involved a  dental surgery that cost over $3,000). I was very pleased when I saw that literally everything pertaining to the surgery (including the diagnostics/tests they needed to run when the infection was discovered) all went toward my deductible and reimbursement. There was not a single surprise or item that wasn't covered and I got my expected 90% reimbursement (after deductible). Highly recommend getting your pets an insurance policy with Fetch as soon as you can!

Please be aware that as your pet ages (and as you go making claims), your pet's premium will increase - one of my cat's premium went from $240 in 2022-2023, to $411 in 2023-2024 (after I made 1 $700 for him)... so we will see what happens to my other cat's premium after his year's dental surgery claim...

text:
Fetch will do ANYTHING and EVERYTHING they can to avoid paying out a legitimate claim. Several months ago, our puppy had an emergency vet visit for clearly presenting a potential bowel obstruction.  Seems like an obvious claim right? Not to Fetch.  So far they've sent us back to the ER vet multiple  times asking for "more information" including the vet's detailed medical notes -- which we've supplied with increasing frustration.  Today they want us to have our regular vet send EVERY MEDICAL RECORD ON FILE FOR THE PUPPY.  They want her vaccination records? What's next? Her CKC parents' ancestry records? Unreasonable, unnecessary and frankly just another transparent effort to avoid a legitimate pay out. And getting to speak to a human? Virtually impossible. We will advise every pet owner we know about our horrible experience, as well as the people who recommended them and if we could cancel our year-long contract today and get a refund we would.
UPDATE:  It took 7 minutes for Fetch to respond online here to our deservedly negative review of their service to assure us that they were addressing our concerns and processing our claim. Three days later, it's been radio silence and no action -- except that they sent us an e-mail asking if we'd recommend them to friends.   Not if we continue to get silence, no updates and the run around -- but we will share our continuing experience on the various dog breed communities we are part of to warn others of what to expect.
title: Fetch insurance is money wasted

text: So far, the experience has been great. They have covered what I expected them too in accordance to our policy. Claims are reviewed in a reasonable amount of time. Our first claim took a lot of time because they needed a lot of initial docs but since then, it has been as easy as submitting an invoice and medical notes. I'm not sure how if I saved all that much money in the first year but I know I will be glad I have it if/when my puppy ever has a major medical issue. He had a minor emergency recently and it would have been so much more stressful if I had to also worry about the money associated with an emergency vet visit.
title: Great experience so far

text:
I have had Fetch insurance for 8 years - I truly regret that I selected this company. 
My monthly fees have skyrocketed each year (from initially being under $100 a month) and took such an extreme leap when my dog turned 6 - going up by $200 a month. 
The only explanation they could provide was that my policy had "too much coverage" (Ie. they don't even offer it anymore) and that at 6 years old my dog (who is a small breed who will easily live over double that) was considered to be a senior. 
I made some policy changes to bring the monthly cost down to $130 - now today I have a policy renewal email saying it's increased by $100 per month yet again. 
Do not use this company - make a choice that offers transparency when it comes to how your policy cost may be adjusted/calculated.

EDIT: Re Fetch Reply - 

At no point throughout my review did I say that Fetch has not covered claims (though there have been times when they have not, despite explanations from my vet). 
And I have spoken with representatives - one of whom candidly acknowledged that because I joined when Fetch was a new company and they no longer offer the level of coverage I initially had, the tactic of raising my monthly rate by over $100 a month at a time is to encourage me to decrease my dogs coverage and effectively force me out of the level of care I have. 
Given I have made use of my policy during some seriously unfortunate heath issues and given that my dog is only half way through his life, I can only imagine what my policy will become cost wise if it continues to be raised by $100 a month yearly as he actually becomes a senior dog.
 
While Fetch has covered many medical bills (as is the purpose of insurance) I would want to know, if I were a new pet owner looking for insurance, that there is no controlled limit to how much your policy cost can be raised it seems, and that the company would have considered my dog senior at the age of 6.
title: Would Not Recommend - Client of 8 years

text:
I've been with Fetch for 4 years. The few times I've needed them have been so easy and quick. Reimbursement is quick and submitting the forms is very simple. The peace of mind it offers is invaluable.

When I first got my puppy I considered getting pet insurance, but I thought I would put away a little each month instead. 6 months in my puppy ate something and got very sick and I had like $300 in the bank for what ended up being a $1500 vet bill. I was so stressed that night and so worried about my puppy. I vowed I would never, ever worry about that again and I signed up for Fetch shortly after this experience. Since then, I've only needed Fetch a couple of times for small things (my dog had a UTI, for example) but the peace of mind has been worth it. I have a cat now and immediately signed him up for Fetch as well.

text:
The customer service is the only reason I gave a 3. I would have given 5 stars on friendly, informative and professionalism. 
However, I would have given 1 star evaluation based on Fetch polices. 
Buyer Beware!! This means as your pet ages and your insurance will increase... For the past couple of years our insurance premium has increased by at least 20% each year! I have had my monthly payment go from $43.00 per month (pup was under a year) to her Second Birthday it was jumped to $58.00 per month! (Don't forget the $6.00 per month charge for processing for on top of that.) 

There is only 2 options to lower this monthly fee. 
1) To adjust her coverage from $10,000 annually to $2,500. Or...
2) To increase my deductible from $300 to a higher annual deductible. (Which replenishes every year at the date you started the policy.)
I chose option 1. Which means I have less coverage annually incase something does happen. 

In my option, based on what I know now, I would research other insurance company's before signing with Fetch. And now I'm waiting for the year I get the increase... I can no longer afford to keep insurance for my beloved pet....Or have so little coverage...what will be the point of it. 
Keep looking.. For the the T in True.

UPDATE in response to Fetch Pet... For the annual increases there may not be a "set" increase. However the percentage I gave is based on the past few years. And these Are the increases I have experienced thus far. And I would like to warn others of these facts. My father has other insurance provider for his dog and his annual increases have been under 5 dollars per month and he has been with them for over 4 years. Without adjusting his coverage!

As for the transparency you claim your company has, "the bunch of Other options" to lower the cost of the premium, please due tell us all. I just do not understand why I have to adjust my coverage to make up for the hike in rates. 

For anyone New to the pet insurance world. Please do your research. I want to help & inform as many as I can.
This review is not based on friendly customer service, it is based on their policies. I feel there are other pet insurance company's out there that have more competitive rates & better overall coverage.
title: Buyer Beware!!

text: Always covered our claims as promised in a timely manner and gave us our beloved Sparky another 2 wonderful years to be with us. As excellent a pet insurance you can find. I recommend them without reservation.
title: The best pet insurance you can find!!!

text: I submitted claims for my pet back in 2022 and to date I am still fighting to get the claims paid.  Our claims have been closed because someone failed to advise what else is needed to complete the process.  Fetch requested medical records from the adoption agency, the vet, and I sent in a 28 page medical report as requested, but the claims remained closed  because no one informed me of the additional report that in needed to completed the process.  Here it is going on nearly two years and still nothing had been done until I thought to call Fetch and see what the hold up was.  That is when I was told that the emergency notes of the doctor was needed.  I am a new pet parent and I learning what and how to do what is necessary to be done.  Fetch should have sent me a message to let me know additional information for my little boy claims to be paid.  Very unhappy with the way I have been treated and I hope no one else have to go through what I am going through to get my claims paid.   Fetch please advise your staff to communicate with the pet parents better than I have been communicated with.
title: I submitted claims for my pet back in 2022

text: I am so very saddened that I have to find another pet insurance for my dear 3-year old Papi-Poo, Quincy. I joined Fetch in March of 2023. I had Quincy examined and uploaded the document within the time frame required when you first sign up. His monthly bill was directly taken out monthly. It wasn't until November of 2023 that he started limping and I took him to the Vet. Turns out it was Medial Luxating Patella. A common joint ailment in his breed. Anyway, the bill was $384. and some change. The deducible is $300. I pay the bill and submit/upload proper paperwork for the $84. This is when the nightmare began. I submitted paperwork for 5 times over a 2month period. It's in review, then more documents are missing, then it's in review, the more documents are missing. I have emailed, and even talk to a human who claimed she fixed the problem. Only to see documents still missing. I cancelled my insurance today and will eat that $84. I'M SO DISAPPOINTED IN FETCH'S CLAIM PROCESSING SYSTEM. I had a horrible experience with them.
title: I am so very saddened that I have to…

text:
I like the customer service and  response time.
I don't like how faxes don't seem to get there.
I find it unfair that even though we our responsible for 100% of the $300 deductible. They take off our percentage PRIOR to calculating the reimbursement rate. Therefore, we end up paying more then the first $300 before getting money back.

 With a $1000 claim at 70% reimbursementrate, they deducted your reimbursement rate off FIRST ( so 30% off the money we are 100% responsible for). Therefore,  making your claim $700 and they reimburse you 70% of that amount. 
SHOULD BE 
$1000.00-$300.00 (deductible)- $210 (30% reimbursement rate)= $679 (their 70% after your deductible).
title: Unfair policy calculations

text:
I didn’t realise there was a 15 day waiting period and unfortunately my cat was ill within that timeframe. After realising this, I cancelled but then got an email on the day of her surgery to resign up again as there would be no issues and no waiting period, no pre existing! It sounded too good to be true but I was hopeful and I resigned up after speaking with Katie who assured me it was all going to be okay. Well, it was too good to be true. Cat had to get surgery for stomatitis which cost $4,500! 

I emailed twice to get my claim reconsidered and got no reply. I called and asked to be put through to the complaints department. They do not have one?! Madness. 

I spoke with the supervisor who basically said tough titty, the wording on the email was confusing and that is not what we meant. No accountability. 

I cancelled and I am waiting to get a trustworthy company. The world of pet insurance is a battlefield.

The reply is even confusing! I tried. It really is a shame I had to resort to trustpilot to get a reply to two emails. Save yourselves the time and get a complaints department.
title: No complaints department, ghosted once declined.

text: This company will call anything allergies. Beware. My doctors notes said nothing about allergies and only about skin lesions. title: Caution...

text: I adopted a cat from a shelter who was healthy as could be. The shelter suggested and signed me up for Fetch. I noticed a week after bringing her home that she was sneezing. I decided to add on the preventative care which said it waved the waiting period for check ups. Took her in for the check up and the doctor gave her a shot of antibiotics to be safe. Bill denied. Took her in for a follow up and a second round of antibiotics. Bill took a month to process and then denied. This was a “prior condition” so it wasn’t covered. Honestly the biggest waste of money and time. I will be canceling. Cheaper to pay out of pocket.
title: Misleading

text: I have had Fetch Pet Insurance since they took over Rosie's previous insurance.  Rosie is 14 year old golden retriever mix with two autoimmune diseases, ITP and Lupus.  Last year she was diagnosed with lung cancer and a few months after her surgery she was diagnosed with diabetes. I am retired, and with all these ongoing medical issues I could never have afforded the major medical bills for the care she needs. She has a surgeon, oncologist, and internal medical specialists. Fetch has been there helping to cover her bills all the way,  She is on chemo and regular visits for her diabetes and these visits can really add up.  She is doing great and I know it is because of the ability to give her the best of care with the help of her insurance.  I would highly recommend Fetch Pet Insurance.

text: We have been with Fetch for both of our dogs for 3 (younger) or 4 (older) years. The premiums have been ticking up annually, but usually manageably. In 2023, they decided to introduce something they have called a "claims surcharge" - essentially a penalty for having used your insurance. It took months of talking to tens of customer service people to figure it out, but we ultimately found out that there are 10%, 20% and 30% penalty tiers based on how many years you have been reimbursed over $250 for. We were in the 20% camp. With a 6 year old dog, 20% of our premium in surcharge is A LOT of money - more money than we were willing to pay on top of the already-sizeable annual premium increase. We were also told that it would take 3 years of claims under $250 to be reduced to the 10% penalty camp. This whole thing seems SUPER SHADY and we have cancelled and are taking our chances with a new insurance company as we can't keep paying hundreds of dollars per month only to get slapped with a "claims surcharge" for ever using the insurance we pay so much for. Hard nope. Do not recommend.
title: Shady "claims surcharge" introduction

text: I bought my insurance for my dog Bruno as a puppy. He had no issues until he turned 6yrs old when he needed major back surgery, at 7 he had a torn ligament on his knee and most recenty at 8 he had major bladder and kidney issues. Unfortunately he passed away Nov 1 and the team not only kept me on the plan throughout all his surgeries, they never said "sorry we need to cancel your insurance". I am forever grateful!!! My Bruno meant everything to me and I would do anything in the world to keep him healthy and safe. If I ever find the heart to get another pet, Fetch will be the place to go. I recommend them to anyone I meet that has a pet. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

text:
They raised the rate 23% after the first year for a healthy puppy!  Gross!!
I spoke with a rep and was informed that if you put in claims, the rate goes up.  We looked over mine and she agreed that the dental preventative (removed 11 teeth from a teacup poodle during her spay b/c she's so little and we don't want to put her to sleep for dental work regularly) contributed to the increase even though it was a one off.  I asked her to have the underwriters review the notes more clearly and she said it's impossible.  They will never review again (so human error means nothing to them).  Don't use Fetch - with annual increases this high -won't be worth it in a few years.

UPDATE
Fetch did get in touch after a few days but it's been a colossal waste of time.  I was told that they'd try to get the underwriters to review the policy (and look more closely at the notes as they'd incorrectly deemed my pet has conditions she does not) but couldn't promise anything and alas, they wouldn't review it.  So Fetch doesn't take their errors into consideration.  Fetch rebranded - they used to be called PETPLAN.  Read those reviews to get a more accurate picture of the company, their integrity (lack of), and service before deciding on this company.
title: They raised the rate 23% after the…

text: The company has excellent customer service and their app is very straightforward and easy to use. I also find their policies to be reasonably priced and they allegedly cover a lot. However, that’s where the good ends. I can’t stress this enough, they will disagree with your vet on what constitutes a pre existing condition. Let me repeat that- they will disagree with a licensed veterinarian regarding your pets health. I have all correspondence from my vet in email- the clinic even called their belief of a pre existing condition silly. Put away whatever money the policy costs per month and save yourself the headache of dealing with this company.
title: They will disagree with your vet on what constitutes a pre existing condition

text:
I just purchased my first ever pet insurance policy from Fetch (after weeks of pouring over different companies/policies) and I called to ask for a few points of clarification. However, I got so much more than that. Amanda, the woman who took my call, was perhaps the best customer service rep/insurance broker I have ever spoken to. Positive, helpful, and genuine—going above and beyond the questions I had, she genuinely seemed to care about the wellbeing of my dog and provided information I will need relative to seeking veterinary care, the questions I should ask the vet, the best practices to receive prompt reimbursement and she was even knowledgeable about veterinary care in my state (New York) even though she lives in the south!
I have had nothing but positive experiences with this company thus far, and their customer service is seriously off the charts. 10/10 recommend. Thank you Amanda! And Fetch.
title: Fetch is great but Amanda is the GOAT

text:
Run don't walk from this company.  I'll give you my honest 13-year experience with examples.  They were actually great for years when they were petplan, but became terrible once taken over by the Dodo (apt name).  A few examples: 1. Want to spend money on a new policy?  They're happy to take your call.  However, if you're spending thousands (and you WILL spend thousands) per year, you're stuck with a crappy chatbot that gives you incomplete and unhelpful options.  After lots of time getting nowhere you'll have to wait for an email response. No time for personal calls once you have your policy.  2. (This one I think is the most egregious, and likely tricks many customers): Your copay plan will have an actual deductible that FAR EXCEEDS the published deductible.  Example: a 70-30 plan with a $500 'per condition' deductible.  When we had expenses they would only apply 70% of those expenses to the deductible.  So you'll find that you spend far more than $500 before you hit your deductible. Simple math means, in fact, that you'll spend $715 to hit a "$500" deductible ($715 X 70% = $500).  Imagine - that's advertised as a $500 deductible.  Take that for each condition because the deductible is 'per condition', and you'll find that you're spending hundreds - if not thousands - more than the published deductible before you get any coverage whatsoever.  Shady.  3. At annual rollover, your premiums will definitely go up, sometimes by 200-300%.  Do they give you notice and an option to continue?  Nope - they used to (with petplan)....but now the Dodo automatically bills you at the new rate.  Want to make a change?  Cancel?  Well, you're stuck with the unhelpful chatbot yet again (which, surprise surprise, includes no 'cancellation' option).  4. Finally, when the company was still petplan we had a death benefit associated with the policy.  After experiencing the deep sadness associated with saying goodbye to our 13 yo lab, we read the fine print of the new policy, which states that no death benefits are paid to animals over age 8.  There's more, but that's enough.  It used to be a great company - now it's profit only.  You can definitely do better - shop around.
UPDATE:
Even after all of this (see reply below), and after cancelling my policy due to the death of our pet, they just charged my credit card again for > $200 for our monthly premium. And NO ONE will answer a call or a move chat to help. Just continuing to make a painful experience unbelievably bad.
title: Update: continuing to charge me after the death and cancellation of policy

text: My cat suffered from resorptive tooth roots and had to have two teeth surgically removed. She needed extensive blood work to prepare her for the surgery which the vet told me would also be covered. After I paid for the surgery, I faithfully submitted my claim with all of my documents. I had at least 10 uploads. I received notification that my application was pending about two times but I never received an email asking me for more documents. After many weeks, I logged on and found that they wanted more documents. In fact, they want all of my animals medical records from August of 2018 forward. I will trouble my vet to see if I can get all of these, although I do have the receipts, but they want the so-called soap records. I cannot believe they make this so ridiculously difficult. What if you change your vet? It's a shame that a 75 year old woman has to wait literally months for a small check after paying in premiums for years. I am so disappointed and wish I had chosen another company.
title: Keep your records FOREVER

text:
I wish I had shopped around more and read more reviews when choosing a pet insurance company for my puppy. When I joined, this was called Pet Plan. Maybe I joined right before the transition to fetch but there was no website to use, only an app that never worked. For about a year the app didn't work. Now it seems ok but its the hugest pain to submit a claim because they don't just accept the straightforward invoice that other companies want...no, no, no, this company wants you to send the vet notes and all of the documents from all of the previous visits before they take their sweet time to process the claim. I mean the longest processing time I've ever experienced. Oh and if you're in Canada, they can figure out how to take your money directly out of your bank account, but not how to deposit it there once you finally see some money back. So they mail you a cheque in the mail!! 
Also, every single year, my premiums have gone up about $10 per month!! So if you think you're getting a deal with the initial quote, think again!! I just got my renewal letter for the coming year. The premiums are going up to over $60/month when I've been paying $45 per month; this is AFTER I halved my coverage last year because the monthly payments keep going crazy high upon renewal. 
Don't forget, with these pet insurance companies, if your puppy ever gets something like an ear infection,  good luck changing to another insurance company because that's called "pre-existing condition" and that will not be covered going forward.

The other thing I'd like to mention here is the fact that one day I looked into my account and could see all of the personal information of another person! Names, addresses, phone number, all pet information and history and even some payment information. I immediately contacted Fetch and they acted like this total breach of private information was no big deal! I personally contacted the person to tell them what had happened and this company didn't even tell them it had happened! I take great issue with that and so should you. 

I feel stuck using them now since my pup has had a few claims.

 I think it would be better to take the money I'm paying in premiums and put it in an account for a day I might really need it for my pup instead.
 
Funny how the company reached out to me after I left this honest review, but has never tried to resolve anything when I call them.
title: I wish I had shopped around more…

text:
Our family suffered the loss of our beloved 14 year old Ridgeback in May of 2023.  Our solace came from our neighbors Akita who lovingly always greeted us kindly and looked for her friend our beloved Oli nearly every day.  My youngest son - who had been particularly close to our dog - wanted a dog for graduation, although we were still feeling our loss his dad and I agreed.  Enter a 10-month old Akita who we renamed Kofe.  From the moment my son met him in the shelter, they had a strong bond.  Everything was going beautifully, we took Kofe everywhere our family went - until August 2023 when the dog became violently ill.  We rushed him to our family vet several times and as he continued to decline, we ended up taking him to the Vet Urgent Care who immediately referred us to The Ohio State University Vet Hospital.  He was in ICU and our son was devistated...we all were worried, would we lose the dog that was just beginning to fill the whole in our hearts?  Money put aside to make necessary house repairs had to be used for the dogs care instead. The expense was big. It was a huge relief that after a frightening week Kofe turned the corner and stabelized - finally allowing us to take him home.

 Enter Fetch Pet Insurance, although there were a couple of occasions where I wish I could of asked a question specifically to our adjuster, overall submitting the documents and receiving some recovery was a beautiful experience.  Our dog is doing well now and our vet is still following him closely. Our son has him by his side almost always.  Plus, Thanks to Fetch we were able to get our home repairs done after all.  I hope you understand, beyond a claim number or documents submitted, there is a family making a choice to save the life of a fury family member who means the world to us.  Fetch gave us an amazing peace of mind, knowing that moving forward our dog has excellent coverage.
title: An Amazing Peace Of Mind

text:
I've had the same insurance for my dogs since they were puppies.  I've been completely satisfied and would recommend Fetch to anyone looking.

title: Consistency

text:
Pet Insurance is a NECESSITY for any Pet Parent. Learn from my mistakes and purchase IMMEDIATELY before anything could be considered “pre-existing”. You are going to have vet bills. Period. You might as well have reassurance that you can be reimbursed for what you’re going to be spending ANYWAYS. Animals have a right to live a healthy life. That is the responsibility you are taking on with a pet. Be responsible.

Fetch has THE most comprehensive dental health coverage on the market. My baby had no dental issues… until he did… and needed 5 teeth removed. Fetch covered it completely, within the conditions of my policy AND pre-approved his sister who is showing slightly less severe signs of gingivitis but signs nonetheless. Had I not had to pay my 250$ deductible… my baby’s 750$ dental surgery would have only been 75$ out of pocket… it’s all about the LONG RUN.
title: Pet Insurance is a NECESSITY

TRUPANION is a disingenuous horrible company to deal with. I am new with FETCH  and they already reimbursed on a claim as well as saving money on the monthly cost with better coverage.  Fetch's deductible is a one time deductible for the whole year while Trupanion deductible is for each and every claim and that is how they avoid paying for claims!!  DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY WITH TRUPANION!! GO FETCH!!!!
title: SWITCHED FROM TRUPANION TO FETCH

text: I have been a client of Fetch (fka Pet Plan) for years and through 6 pets. Fetch has always paid claims with no questions asked or tried to finagle out of veterinary charges or argue a treatment wasn't necessary. The claims process is simple and easy. They have improved how deductibles work from the old days. The only complaint I have is the exorbitant charges they level as your pets age. I understand that this is a business, however, feeling like you are being kicked out of the "program" that you have remained with and that has been with you to care for your pets is not a good feeling. I can't figure out if they exponentially increase the premiums on purpose to encourage clients to drop out of the program because they find them too big a risk or if that is just their premium model but it leaves you feeling like this partner you had is basically price gouging you when you have been loyally paying premiums for years. Again, I understand it is a business and I am grateful to be able to have access to pet insurance but the premiums past age 10 or so insane that it leaves you in a gap where the premiums are so expensive and dropping the coverage would be risky because your pet isn't quite old enough where expensive care or treatment options may still be warranted. It is the only  part of Fetch that has had me looking at other providers and, maybe I'll find it is the same or the benefits during the younger years are not as good. I do not yet know.
title: Love Fetch-Hate Extreme Premium Increases as Pets Age

text:
When our rescued Golden Retriever came to us at 11 months, he was beautiful and healthy if a little skinny. 
But we had been there before so we bought Pet Plan (now Fetch) for him as we had for our other dogs.  That was fortunate.  2 years later we found out Buddy had severe hip dysplasia and he got his first hip replacement then another 2 years and another hip replacement.  Without insurance that would have cost us approximately $15000 for the 2.  With insurance it was around $4500.  Then recently, at age 8, after a lot of testing the vet found a lump on his thyroid that turned out to be a thyroid tumor.  $3000 for the CAT scan and another $5000 for the surgery and biopsy.  The biopsy showed it to be malignant.  Thankfully, caught early, he is recovering well. We paid $2400. We would have paid for all of this, regardless of whether we had insurance, because our dogs are our children but it sure made it easier knowing we had insurance to help cover these unexpected costs.  Fetch never balked at the costs and paid quickly exactly as expected.  We have recommended insuring pets many times over the years and Fetch is definitely an above average company.
title: The world's most expensive rescue dog!!

title: Friendly Service

text:
I've been a loyal customer of Fetch Pet Insurance for an astounding 14 years, and I can confidently say that their coverage is nothing short of amazing. Throughout my journey with Fetch, I've had the pleasure of experiencing their exceptional service and comprehensive coverage firsthand, making a challenging time in my life a little easier.

Fetch Pet Insurance's coverage is truly impressive. They cover virtually everything, with the exception of preexisting conditions and routine visits like vaccines. This coverage came in handy, especially during the first two years of my beloved Frenchie's life when it more than paid for itself. Knowing that I had Fetch by my side to help with unexpected medical expenses provided invaluable peace of mind.

However, what truly sets Fetch apart is their outstanding customer service, and in particular, Heather Fisher. When my Frenchie sadly passed away on September 20, 2023, I needed to make the difficult decision to cancel his insurance. Heather Fisher was there to guide me through the process with unwavering compassion and professionalism.

Heather took her time to ensure I understood every step of the process and patiently answered all my questions. She displayed a genuine understanding of the emotional difficulty of the situation and went above and beyond to provide support during a trying time. Most notably, she was able to backdate my bill and promptly reimbursed me for the month of October, something I genuinely appreciated.

Losing a pet is an incredibly emotional and challenging experience, and often, practical matters like canceling insurance can slip through the cracks as we cope with our grief. Heather's proactive assistance was a reminder that Fetch Pet Insurance genuinely cares about its customers and their pets, even during the most difficult moments.

In conclusion, Fetch Pet Insurance has been a lifeline for me and my furry family member for over a decade, providing excellent coverage and unwavering support. The compassionate service I received from Heather Fisher during my Frenchie's passing further solidified my trust in this company. I highly recommend Fetch Pet Insurance to any pet owner looking for comprehensive coverage and exceptional customer service. They truly understand the bond between pet and owner and will be there for you when it matters most.
title: I've been a loyal customer of Fetch Pet…

title: Whenever I had questions and phone a…

text:
Update: Fetch reached out to me to say they indeed paid me but this was for a completely different claim.  The dental cleaning and the corresponding $100 reimbursement I was owed for subscribing to the wellness plan was indeed denied.  They denied it under the wellness plan as well as the regular insurance plan, all because my puppy needed a teeth cleaning. So if teeth are in need of a cleaning, they will not pay the $100 entitles for a cleaning. If your puppy does NOT need a cleaning then they’re happy to pay for something that does not need to be done. Makes total sense. Again, be very careful as they will make you feel safe and secure with this wellness plan but will then refuse to pay when you try and use it.  Total scam. 

This company totally violates the trust you have that they will be there if you ever need them.  I get it, an insurance company needs to make money.  Fetch was completely dishonest in the way they marketed their product.  I signed up for Fetch and the biggest reason I chose this company over all of the others is their wellness plan. I paid almost double the normal premium to include the wellness plan that gives you menu back towards things like vaccinations, heart worm medicine and, more importantly, money towards dental cleaning. My puppy had a dental cleaning scheduled for months. Her checkup before the dental cleaning had the doctor noting stage 1 periodontal disease. This is very common and highlights the need for annual cleanings. But because of the stage 1, fetch denied the claim for dental cleaning. That’s fine. Preexisting condition. Sure. But they also denied the $100 reimbursement from the wellness plan I paid for because of it. Nowhere did it EVER say that the wellness plan that you pay extra for has severe limitations and exclusions just like the regular insurance. So it makes me worry in the future what else this company will deny. You place your trust and your money in this company and they act like they want to care about your pet. But what happens when you need them the most? Will they leave you high and dry? This is all about trust and the question is can you trust this company to honor their commitment to your pet?
title: This company totally violates trust.

text: Best experienced i ever had..My dog got hit by a car last sept,i just upload the final invoice and medical records and i got my claims for a couple of days.Very easy..The apps works great and fast.Im so grateful for fetch but i hope they wont increase my monthly payment..
