text:
Recently, as my dog has aged, there have been some issues that have required medical care. Having this insurance has made it very easy to say yes to testing that is needed and can be very expensive. This past September he had a sprain that made him miserable. I had to go.to vet ER. He needed imaging, radiology, labs and everything in the crock pot, lol. We were discharged and had a follow up with his regular vet a few days later per ER instructions.
I filed one claim on a Monday and it was paid by the Friday. And the follow up visit was paid in 9 days!!! I was impressed. My vet wanted to know the name of the company as all the ones they offer have had negative feedback. I gladly provided Fetch's information as they got to see the EOB for ER payment and how quickly it was resolved. 
I've had my dog covered for 10 years now, it does get more expensive as he ages, but the peace of mind in making care decisions for him knowing Fetch will reimburse covered care quickly, is absolutely worth it!!!!
title: Satisfaction Guaranteed

text:
I have been a Fetch customer for about four years, after having to make a really tough decision for my cat that I never had to make again.  All my pets are covered with 90 percent coverage, as I find it much easier to budget for the monthly premium than a surprise vet bill. While I haven't needed to use it for two of my pets, my cat Luna eats everything off the ground and has needed two linear foreign body removals and treatment for gastro upset. In total, this would have cost me about 10k over the last few years. The process for submitting the necessary paperwork is easy with the app, and they are very communicative with the status
 While the time between submission and decision can take a bit and that's a stressful time, they have always provided payment. I recommend them to all my friends and family who have pets.
title: Piece of mind is invaluable.

text:
I guess it’s not for everybody.
We got our 11 month old rescue insured. Despite an email that noted only hip/leg issues would be declined within the first 6 months (this would be deemed “pre-existing”)… our first claim for a UTI (at least four months after getting her insured), they said it was pre-existing and denied the claim.
This happened again with an ear infection.
An eye infection (about a year into this) was finally accepted, but after the deductions, was almost negligible.
It should be noted we provided the “soap notes” from the initial vet visit, which showed she was healthy. (We are family to the original owners who could not manage her).
In the end, we cancelled the insurance and were rewarded with multiple offers to renew with no penalties!
To us… this felt like a scam! 
Your mileage may vary!
title: Felt like a scam

text:
My partner and I are both veterinarians and will never use fetch again nor recommend it to clients. Paid premiums for years (6.5k total) and have been declined coverage for our cat who developed diabetes this spring. Based on my experience working with insurance companies I believe fetch is the one that most consistently fights to not pay out legitimate claims - my other pets are insured with other companies. The absolute patronizing manner with which I was spoken to by Don is beyond unacceptable. Insurance companies like Fetch make my job more difficult as negative experiences with insurance companies will lead to less pet owners being covered and more instances of appropriate medical care being out of reach for uninsured pet owners. 

EDIT: After receiving a phone call to follow up with this review, was given the exact same non-sensical run around - pointless and a waste of time. The net result of our cat's insurance coverage? Thousands of dollars completely wasted. The implication in the response to this review that this could have been a pre-existing condition (unmanaged diabetic over 4 years?!) is medically ridiculous - he had full bloodwork panels and was completely asymptomatic prior to developing symptoms this year - just an excuse not to cover.

I'm happy that at least the company has kind people working there, I was treated very well by everyone, but that's it, when you start paying for insurance no one tells you that you need to have your dog checked out. And when you don't do this, every problem your dog has, they say it's pre-existing so they don’t pay you. My dog ​​came from Brazil, without any problems because a sick dog cannot travel. He had a check up in Brazil to travel and came here in May, in August he had skin problems, and the vet thinks it is an allergy to the environment make sense he is in a new country. Fetch refused to pay for the claim because they claim it could be something pre-existing. So why don't they ask us to do a check up when we start paying the company? Now I have a big problem because if I start at another company this will be a pre-existing problem, so I need to stay on my own. When I called to close my police they told me, pay for a check up and the next things will be covered, and we ignore the problem that appears now? Do I keep paying them and the medicine? Why they didn't tell me this before a problem appeared, very mean of you. For you it’s just one more person or few dollars but for me it is stability of my family, it is not a joke. I am very upset I didn’t expect that. Thank you for causing me such a headache.

About the reply: If this is the issue, they should have warned me beforehand, it is necessary to make the rules clear, none of my friends had a check up before the first problem with their pet. And as I said, my dog ​​came from another country, he did a check to travel, this is mandatory, the CZI is an international document and even though I presented this, you ignored it, the only way to help me is by recognizing my claim, which is legitimate, in otherwise I will look for my legal rights

For example, in 2020 it was during the pandemic when most vets are not taking in any annual exams only emergency cases.  My claim was denied because my dog did not get an annual exam every year despite it was during a pandemic.  They also never ask for me to submit the medical record in 2015 when I started the policy.  However, right now they are saying I am unable to provide the medical record in 2015 therefore the claim is also denied.  They are finding every excuse to deny my claim. text:
Unfortunately I had thought I found a great pet insurance provider with Fetch. I have been using Fetch for 3 years with our Dog. I had the highest of the insurance plans with unlimited coverage, low deductible and high reimbursement rate. I accepted Fetch's increased yearly renewal fee as I wanted to best coverage for our dog. This year when my plan was renewed they automatically dropped me into their low-end insurance plan saying we used our insurance to a level where they paid for insurance claims higher than our monthly amount so we were automatically reduced into a low-end offering and nothing we could do about it. This is completely upsetting - after all, isn't insurance supposed to be used? After speaking with 2 Fetch representatives (manager) they called attention to fine print somewhere which is their loophole to doing this unfortunate action. Fetch will penalize you for actually using their insurance. I don't recommend moving forward with choosing Fetch as your animal insurance coverage- if you ultimately end up using your insurance you will get penalized. 

As a high advocate for dogs and as someone who is very involved in national dog groups and leading my own chapter, I will be letting all my alliances and members know this is not the insurance to choose if they want best in class support. This is very unfortunate as I wanted to very much like Fetch and had a few good experiences with them, but was proved very wrong.
title: Misleading insurance - don't recommend

text: The most unhelpful pet insurance I've ever had. Customer service needs a serious upgrade. I had the policy for nearly a year for both of my dogs. Since getting Fetch they have not reimbursed me for a single thing. With my first dog, I understand there's a 2 weeks grace period where nothing pre-existing is covered, understandable. My dog had giardia, he was treated for it, tested NEGATIVE and giardia free for awhile. When he had a 2nd giardia infection well after the 2 weeks grace period, they declined my claims, stating it was pre-existing. I submitted a claim for my second's hair loss, they denied it saying they weren't my primary insurance and wasn't given a real reason why they weren't my primary insurance. There were no explanations in their emails. I purchased Fetch first before purchasing Trupanion, they never once told me what makes them primary or secondary. When I tried to cancel or find any kind of customer service, it was nearly impossible to get a real person. The bot offered unhelpful prompts. The phone tree sent me around and around until I tried nearly every option to get a real person. We requested cancellation email on the policies as well on the claims, they failed to deliver the latter. I've been having such a hard time filing my claims with Trupanion because I am waiting on cancelation emails/proof from Fetch. It's been months, still dealing with this. I don't understand why I have to spend hours and days trying to resolve an issue, only to be met with disappointment over and over. I now have to call again to ask for a simple claims cancellation email has proof/documentation so I can file with Trupanion insurance.
title: The most unhelpful insurance.

text:
When this company was PetPlan they were wonderful. I had joined prior to 2012 and when my cat Franklin went into decline PetPlan was supportive and offered the assistance I needed in covering his care and finally his cremation.
When we rescued another cat after Franklin passed on in 2015, I immediately enrolled him with PetPlan. I had no idea that when PetPlan changed to Fetch in 2022, they had changed their policies. 
Jonesy was a very healthy and happy Tuxedo kitty who sadly took a quick decline at the end of July. He had no reason to go to the vet prior "just because." We had adopted him as an adult so he was neutered and had been with a family so had his original shots etc. 
How utterly shocked and horrified am I now that Fetch has denied ALL CLAIMS over not having superfluous annual visits that were not a part of the original insurance plan. After paying for insurance for 8 YEARS they have no decency in helping out with three invoices. They happily took almost $6,000.00 from me for insurance coverage knowing that I would never be able to receive any reimbursement. 
I will NEVER recommend this company to ANY PET PARENT.
title: Mercenary, Unethical and Deceptive Insurance Company

They increase your monthly payment by $20/month without warning. I started out paying $37/Month 8 years ago. Now I pay $80 - having that I paid about $57 as of last year… you can see where I have a problem. This increase came with zero warning to me. Sure my dog had some arthritis related issues but as of today she hasn’t needed anything big at the vet, no surgeries or anything like that. So.. do with that info what you want. I’d definitely gone a different route if I could.

text:
Although the first claim took a lot longer than I would have liked, every experience since then has been great. Claims are paid out quickly when you have direct deposit set up. 

One thing I didn't care much for is the requirement of the vet notes because the requirement is that the notes have the complete history uploaded every time a claim is made. This ends up with years worth of vet notes over the pets life time. 

It would be great if the documents for vet notes could be saved to the account to be reviewed when necessary so that only the applicable notes needed to be uploaded. The reason being that sometimes these take time to get from my vet and it really delays the payment of the claim.

Overall, I find the insurance to be comprehensive and affordable. It's customizable and recently I got a little discount for my dog being a healthy happy girl. That was a really nice bonus I wasn't expecting and I really appreciated it!
title: Great experience, wish document collection was simpler

text:
We first purchased our dog's insurance through Pet Plan when she was about 3 months old.  At sometime it was taken over by Fetch.  We had never had to submit a claim until this year.  I don't recall PetPlan having a time limit to submit a claim.  Our dog had her first injury earlier this year.  It would have barely covered the $300 deductible, so I didn't submit it immediately.  A few months later when she was bred, she miscarried.  After which I submitted both claims.  At which time I learned that I was slightly past the time limit to submit the first claim, so it was totally denied.  Ironically we had problems with Fetch sending us information about some other dog that wasn't even our dog for about a YEAR
before I got someone to get it corrected.  Yet the company expects the customer to submit claims in a short time, far shorter than a year.
title: Unhappy customer

text:
I gave my dog a policy with unlimited coverage, a $300 deductible, and a 90% reimbursement rate. Now, after my dog has gotten ill and will be denied for any other insurance company, they have lowered me to a fixed amount of coverage per year, a $500 deductible and only a 70% reimbursement rate. I’m sure they’ll tell me “you can cancel whenever you want” but now all of these things are going to be pre-existing conditions with another company and I’m left with poor coverage, when I elected to give my dog good coverage and pay for it. This is despicable treatment.

EDIT: I called, and they went beyond what I thought they would say. I was told the reason this happened is because “they were paying more in claims than they were receiving in premium payments” isn’t that the entire purpose of insurance?? Peace of mind in case this happens? You do birthday pricing that increases the premium up to 15x by the time my dog is senior, you were going to get your money back. Even if not from me, the vast majority of owners will pay significantly more in premiums than they will get in reimbursement, in case they become part of the significant minority that needs more coverage than they paid that year in premiums. That’s what you exist for. For you to slash my coverage because I needed you to do exactly what your purpose is, is beyond immoral. If people knew this is what you’d do if they ever needed you, they wouldn’t choose you for “coverage”. My recommendation to anyone reading this: choose Trupanion! They not only don’t do birthday pricing, but they will NEVER slash your coverage. Make the right decision before you end up being too late, like me. My baby girl cannot be covered anywhere else now because nothing she suffers from will be covered. Not all pet insurance is truly pet insurance, Fetch certainly isn’t. Choose Trupanion.
title: I gave my dog a policy with unlimited…

In addition to her chemo she also gets weekly acupuncture sessions along with her scheduled vet visits. Bentley (4yr old Cocker Spaniel) was recently hospitalized for five days with pancreatitis. Lastly, Gizmo (13yr old Cockapoo) diagnosed with Cushings disease also receives the best of care. Knowing I have Fetch relieves the financial stress. Using the app to upload my claims is super simple and reimbursement is always quick. Any questions or concerns I have are always answered quickly and professionally. Thank you Fetch for providing such great service I can count on.

text:
Where do I start fetch insurance has given me the runaround I had a premium for 5 months I had three claims they denied all three claims stating they were prior issues which if they would have reviewed My dog's medical history as it was supplied to them they would have seen that he has consistent ear infections in his left ear okay cool makes sense they wouldn't cover it however he had a ear infection in his right ear which was his first time ever they denied it said it was a reoccurring problem clearly it's not since it's the complete opposite ear. Then they denied a sick visit and then they denied another ear infection in his right ear which was once again not a prior issue before insurance. I asked because they were not providing the services I paid for a full reimbursement of my premium of 5 months and they denied me stating that nothing I filed a claim for was covered under my policy or it was a reoccurring issue once again they clearly did not review his medical history. I then filed the complaint with the better Business bureau upon filing the complaint mid-April fetch then proceeded to go into my policy and change things that I got email alerts for to cover their own asses in a possible legal dispute they openly admitted they had an error and they adjusted the error and applied it to my deductible this is all after I canceled my policy and we were being mediated by the better Business bureau. They have denied reimbursing me my premium they have denied changing things after openly emitting they change things. This company will not pay out they will find any excuse in any reason to not cover their end of the policy they are a scam. I have fought with them since April and have gotten absolutely nowhere's they continue to deny anything and everything to do with either one covering their end of my policy or reimbursing me for my policy term. I am at the point where I have pretty much told them to shove the money up their ass and that I will now share my experiences with their company with other future potential or current consumers. As a pet owner you all know how expensive vets are how they definitely like to pull on the heartstrings because you care about your pet and want to upcharge everything to maximize profits off you so you go shopping for insurance and this is what You can expect to receive for customer service from fetch. I've heard wonderful things about Costco and chewy for pet insurance. If you choose to go with fetch for insurance for your pets don't be surprised when this is the outcome that you also face. They have stolen roughly $400 from me and had zero intentions to ever provide me with The services I was paying for. There Is many many options out there please do your research and don't make the mistake I did by trusting this joke of a business with a policy for my dogs well-being because at the end of the day they don't care about you or your animals

EDIT IN RESPONSE TO BUSINESS REPLY: There's a lot of improvement for fetch to make to be worth anybody even considering applying for a policy through the joke You call an insurance company. Simple request of refunding my money because you failed as a company and openly admitted through the BBB conversations that you made errors on your part in my policy and you did nothing to fix said errors until the BBB was involved there is no amount of improvements that can made to be considered a credible business
title: They are a scam

text:
In the past 15 years, I have had a total of 7 pets on Fetch. I pay for the most coverage. Unfortunately I’ve had some bad health luck with my fur babies over the years. Fetch Pet Insurance has never ever let us down! For all those people who are unsure, all I can say is get Fetch! Years ago, my husband was skeptical of Pet Insurance and now it’s the first thing we do when we get a new pet! We would not be the same pet owners without Fetch. Just knowing when your fur baby is sick that you can say “yes” to needed tests or needed procedures is such a relief. In most cases, I get my reimbursement before my credit card bill even comes in. It is quick and easy!
Fetch brings us peace of mind!
title: In the past 15 years

text: Had FetchPet insurance for 9 years and 2 months and then the premium went up 60% to a jaw dropping premium of over $3600....I was told that I should have been sending in ALL VET BILLS during this long time period, because sometimes they'll pay for things and other times they won't...WHO KNEW???...as of this month, they have a Wellness Plan...I'm sure it's a fortune, because it's an additional premium on top of the $3600...FetchPet is only good for catastrophic incidents and illnesses...it pays for none of the bills you get routinely taking care of your pet....it's not an ethical or honorable business...BEWARE and look elsewhere for similar coverage at a MUCH LOWER PRICE.
title: Beware of this overpriced Vet insurance…

text: We got a puppy in December 2022 and I bought an insurance policy with Fetch after looking at online reviews from policyholders who had made claims.  Fetch had not been on my radar, but the reviews were positive and compelling.  Our dog, a Havanese, developed problems with his bite when baby teeth failed to fall out.  Mouth got crowded when adult teeth grew in, sinus cavity was close to being penetrated, teeth growing every which way.  Extractions and filing were necessary at about 9 1/2 months of age.  I filed a claim and Fetch paid it promptly, in keeping with the terms of my policy - 90% with a $300 deductible. No surprises, no delays.  Direct deposit into my account.  An easy process on line with clear acknowledgement from Fetch after I submitted the claim.  This is why I purchased Pet Insurance, and Fetch covered my claim exactly as I expected - unlike my experience with our previous dog and another pet insurance company.  I will recommend Fetch to other dog owners.
title: Prompt Payment of My Claim

text:
POLICY NUMBER CAT0307773-01 Re: Your claim for $715.90 was not approved

Rated negative stars. We submitted a claim because our cat got very suddenly sick with no preexisting condition. There was a ONE DAY DIFFERENCE in our claim so they denied us and wouldn't listen to reason. Upon further inspection on Social Media, we learned they actually scam people over this kind of thing, frequently. This rating is wildly incorrect and they should be shut down or regulated by someone who actually cares. We reviewed the policy and we were well within it, only to be met with immediate refusal. 

AND THEN they tried begging us to come back. How dare you.

Edit to respond: IT WAS NOT PRE EXISTING! Get some reading comprehension, read above where it's says NOT PREEXISTING it even says it on the SOAP notes. What a horrifying business practice. I hope you go bankrupt.

text:
Stay away from Fetch by the DoDo for your dogs. I had the insurance for my two pups. North Regent Animal Hospital spayed both pups, and both dogs got infected. Lucy had to wear a cone three times longer than usual because her stitches kept popping open. That’s when I enrolled them in Fetch. Later I included my 10 yr old rescue, Oreo for 438. Every three months (premium). Mocha had to go to Veterinary Emergency Group (VEG) in White Plains because she had a fever. Veg was great! They saved Mocha’s life and removed the stitches after we had a falling out with NORTH Regent Animal Hospital in Port Chester. Fetch reimbursed 80% for Mocha. When Lucy was spayed three years ago—then I didn't have Fetch—but Lucy was the reason I decided to get insurance. Oreo needed knee injections due to arthritis twice a week for three months and bloodwork. I assumed Fetch would reimburse me 80%, but they wanted more records. NRAH had blocked my number, so our new vet, Rye-Harrison Veterinarians reached out, and I received a copy. “Not Covered,” Nobody from Fetch told me that “lameness” was not covered. Please read the fine print!

Does anybody have a more humane insurance company? Should I take a chance and do without insurance?

Then why did you take my 11yr old with a high-premium if you had no plan to cover my rescue, Oreo? Give me back my money.

WAG0257583-02 
Trustpilot sent me an Email:

Fetch Pet Insurance would love to understand your experience better, so they’ve asked for more details about your review—like an order number or email.

If we don’t hear from you within 3 days, your review may be taken offline.

So, I would like to keep my review up, because I don't want anyone to get shafted like I did. I have nothing to add except the senior dog started limping after I added her to the fetch account. But Fetch said they weren't enough for "soap notes" from our previous vet who botched two spayings of our younger pups; one almost died. North Regent Animal Hospital kept testing our 11 year old Portuguese Water Dog--an MRI for 3,000.00--total 11,000.00. Finally, the people who did the MRI recommended an Ophthalmologist said he's blind. She also said he had Sudden Acquired Retinal Atrophy Syndrome (S.A.R.D.S.)--Leo died miserably. After the first pup's  botched spaying, we got Fetch by the Dodo. So when the second pup, Mocha was spayed and became septic, (VEG in White Plains, NY) saved her life; that's when we stopped going to North Regent Animal Hospital and began using Rye Harrison Vet (whom I love).  Fetch paid 80% after my deductible. I was very happy with Fetch and decided the larger premium for my senior rescue, Oreo would be worth it. We brought her to Rye-Harrison Vet after a few days of limping. She received Adequan Shots in her back knees twice weekly (and now once monthly). Denied, Denied, Denied by Fetch; "We don't cover lameness." I am following Trustpilot's policy because I don't want anyone else to get "do-do-ed on"  by Fetch!
title: Stay away from Fetch by the DoDo for…

text: Beyond disappointed with this company. Read the fine print as they have just increased the cost substantially because my dog turned 5. They were not at all transparent about prices increasing when I signed up when my dog was a puppy. The customer service reps only explanation was we are allowed to make increases… we are an insurance company. I cancelled their policy and do not recommend them .

text: Have had this policy going on 3 years now and have never had my annual claims exceed what my premiums paid were, meaning that I have not used this insurance to support having it as a benefit. Other than having it "In Case" an accident or illness happens to my pet as a comfort knowing I have it. This was fine at first but since I first began the policy has increased in cost from apx. $300 a year to over $450 a year. Given that my pet is young and indoors and if the policy costs continue to climb it may be more prudent to save that $ each year as the premiums paid if instead saved could exceed the benefits ever received. The policies are pricing me out of the desire to have one. Coupled that these policies do not include any well care benefits or any dental benefits it is quite plain to see that Fetch (all though a cute name for a company), really does not care about the well-being of my pet or anyone's pet, for if they did they would cover the items to keep the pet healthy
title: Have had this policy going on 3 years…

text: The plans are very straightforward, easy to understand and work exactly the way they’re supposed to, provided your vet cooperates. Fetch will not contact your vet to get records or verify sick visits, so your claim will be rejected. It’s also difficult to get in touch with a live person from Fetch to explain this issue. When we have needed to use a specialist at a hospital with lots of administrative staff, they filed the claims for us, including all medical records and we were promptly reimbursed per the terms of our plan.

text: I wish there was a zero star rating. There isn't enough space in this data field to explain the whole experience. Initially there was a lot of conflicting information given about whether or not I needed an initial exam for the dog. They told me alternately to get one and submit it, get one and hang on to it, and not to worry about it. After paying a year's worth of premium, my dog got lyme disease after the worst tick season in MN that anyone I've talked to can remember. Coverage was denied based on lack of proof of preventative measures. It was not made clear to by anyone that I needed to have preventatives in place when I needed to know. It's just a bait-and-switch and a mechanism to avoid covering a treatment. Then when I cancelled my policy, they sent an email saying they'd review the claim in order to retain my business, but when I called all they did was regurgitate the same lines over and over for a half an hour, and refused to make any concessions, so all they did was waste my time. Fetch is a totally disrespectful money-grabbing company that clearly intends to use any means necessary to get your money without holding up their end of the bargain. And gosh, thanks again, Felch, for parroting the same thing YET AGAIN in your reply to this review.
title: I wish there was a zero star rating

text: Fetch Pet Insurance was recommended by the rescue organization when I adopted my last dog and I am so grateful I took their advice. Within a month of her adoption, she was diagnosed with arthritis and later cancer. Because of Fetch, we were able to explore all treatment options (some of which may have been cost prohibitive without insurance) and although she was only with us a short time, we were able to give her the best quality of life possible. Our cat now has a policy and so does our new puppy - as will all of our future pets. They give us so much and it's the least we can do to ensure that the cost of treatment is never a factor when making decisions relating to their care. The puppy was hospitalized recently for eating something she shouldn't have and the claim process couldn't have been easier. Fetch sent updates on the status of the claim every step of the way and we were reimbursed within days.

text:
My 10 month old puppy recently woke up vomiting which necessitated an ER vet visit.  Nothing was found on the initial imaging or bloodwork, so we were sent home.  The next morning he was worse and had bloody diarrhea so he was admitted for 24 hours to stabilize him.  Since nothing was found, we then went for a detailed ultrasound with a specialist.  Fetch has approved all of my claims quickly and without hassle, which has allowed me to continue to focus on what’s important-my pup.  If not for the pet insurance I would have spent about $5,000 already.  

Everyone should have pet insurance and Fetch continues to be at the top of my list when I suggest pet insurance to friends.
title: Insurance is a necessity and Fetch is at the top of my list

text:
We got Fetch Pet Insurance when we first brought our corgi home because the breed tends to have back issues later in life. Little did we know, we'd need to use the insurance much sooner than we thought! After a trip to the emergency vet for an ingested foreign body, we'd met our deductible--thankfully, because just a few months later, we made a trip to the vet that revealed a broken tooth that needed extracted. Fetch quickly processed the claim and reimbursed us for the percentage of our visit that our policy covered. It was quick and easy. 

We love Fetch for the peace of mind they give us and the wholehearted ability to tell our vet to do whatever it takes to keep our babies safe and healthy. We'd recommend Fetch a hundred times over!
title: Highly Recommend! Great Company & Quick Service

text:
My pet test positive for Giardia and Fetch Pet Insurance denied the claim.  They said because he experienced diarrhea before, there is an exclusionary period of 365 days before diarrhea can be claimed. 

This is beyond nonsensical given dogs get diarrhea for multiple reasons from something small as changing their food to them eating something they should not have or in my case he contracted a parasite. 

When I reached out to customer support, they kept reiterating their policy and would refuse to acknowledge we are discussed Giardia, not diarrhea. 

Their suggestion was for me to get more documentation for a reassessment.  They already have all of my pet's medical records since the day I adopted him.  They couldn't tell me what additional information to provide when I asked for some guidance.  

I am at a loss for this situation for something as simple as this claim.
title: My pet test positive for Giardia and…

text: Having learned the hard way, I am sure to have pet insurnace on my dogs now. I have always used manypets.com, trupanion, or embrace. I shopped around due to price and found a lower price with fetch....I was also reminded that you get what you pay for. None of my other insurance companies that we refer to have ever taken more than 48-72 hours max from the time a claim was submitted until the reimbursement hit the bank account. Not true here. 7 days later after a simple wellness exam and the claim is still "in review" and the customer service rep that I tried to chat with about it was just cold. This company isn't worth saving a few dimes and nickels over. I'll be referring my patients and my own dogs to trupanion or many pets going foward - they've put their money where their mouth is and didn't give me some made up run around. I feel foolish for thinking a less expensive company could give us the care that others did.
title: Having learned the hard way

text: I was unsure if I wanted pet insurance, if it would be worth it, how to choose a company, but Fetch has been true to its word and the policy since the start. The policy is very clearly written and laid out. Their terms are fair. I love that services like physical therapy is covered, that I can pay annually instead of monthly for the entire premium, that I can use chat features to talk with representatives, and that I can upload documents via the app. My dog will have Fetch insurance for the rest of her life and any future fur babies are going to be signed up right at the start!

text: Lily is the first dog that I have bought pet insurance for and I maxed out my $10,000 Fetch pet insurance policy on Lily. She’s a mischievous puppy who needed to go to the emergency veterinary hospital twice. The first visit she had shredded a toy and had a 3/4” diameter wad of fibrous material in her large intestine. We were only covered with pet insurance for 11 days. The second visit was from eating a tulip in my garden which I found out is highly toxic to dogs. Lily was in shock and unresponsive when we brought in to the hospital. She spent four days in the hospital. Fetch was very responsive with their review of both cases and giving us refunds. I am so thankful to have had pet insurance and can’t wait to renew my policy next year. Best money I have ever spent in buying Fetch pet insurance.

text:
Fetch Insurance has been a lifesaver for my 2 youngest, Grayson and Gracie who both turned 2 in May. I took them in for their annual wellness check which included vaccinations. They both had severe adverse reactions within 24 hours. Having Fetch insurance gave me peace of mind to not delay getting them in asap which actually ended up being a critical decision to admit them for on demand care. Gracie being only 10lbs had a fever of 105, was on the verge of heat stroke. Grayson at 13lbs was 103. They needed IVs plus other injections to combat the injections and additional side effects like severe diarrhea and vomiting. If I had been concerned about cost I might of waited another 24 hours to see if they would have pulled through it as the vet had told me they would be a bit off for a day or two. The annual exam/shots followed by immediate critical care quickly ballooned to $1k. After submitting my claims I was reimbursed 80% via direct deposit in about 10 days. Fetch is very good about contacting the vet directly for SOAP notes, etc. 

This is my 1st time obtaining insurance for my cats. Is easy to determine that when they are young, they are healthy and won't need it until they are older. Not true. There's been a few other times I've had to take them in. Those claims were also approved without hesitation. The care they have received has more than paid for the insurance premiums. Highly recommend Fetch for anyone considering pet insurance.
title: Fetch Insurance has been a lifesaver…

text: The marketing on what Fetch covers is very misleading. I chose them as I thought I was getting my puppy premium coverage. 2 years later and many claims rejected with zero reimbursement, I have recalculated the math. Yearly you will have to pay approximately $1.2k in insurance and vet bills before they will cover emergencies and new health conditions. I recommend putting that $1.2k in a savings account yearly to cover your own pets issues as you see fit. Say your pet has $4k vet bill when they are 2 years old. You would have already paid $2.4K towards achieving the insurance requirements. Then they cover 80 percent of that. You are now paying at least $800 of that vet bill. So technically you paid $3200 of that $4k vet bill.

text:
Feeling completely scammed by Fetch right now. Our puppy had giardia when we adopted her from a rescue - before we had insurance. We got her treated and lab work confirmed it was resolved.  Last week she was vomiting and the vet suspected an obstruction. Ordered x-rays which I felt confident approving because I thought I had insurance. Fetch just denied my claim because our dog had vomited in the last year. The two incidents having nothing to do with each other. I wish I was kidding. Vomiting in dogs happens all the time for so many possible reasons and is not a "condition". I'm going to find a better company who knows the actual definition of pre-existing condition.

Updated: this is now resolved thanks to advocacy from my vet. If you're denied by Fetch, I recommend asking your vet to help. Not a great experience, but I did get reimbursed.

text: Long post but, please read for the sake of your babies. I had my two dogs previously under a different insurance company but switched after seeing seeing ads and speaking with a customer service representative. I was told about the 15 day waiting period and the 6 month period for knees and hips. I was also told the 6 month waiting period (for both) would be waived with a vet visit at the start of our policy, which we did. I felt confident in the switch because of the coverage and lower prices. Our younger dog started limping after a day at the park, we thought she had cut her paw or hurt it. It turned out to be her hips and it was hip dysplasia. When turning in the claims they originally were sent back multiple times for “missing documents.” We had forwarded her whole file! They then denied the claim because it was within the 6 month period for hips. I tried explaining that I was told by the representative specifically when joining that they were covered. They said only the knees were. I asked them to please go back and listen to the recording and of course they called back and said it never happened. I was gaslit and let down by this company. Don’t waste your time and money on a company that couldn’t care less about their ill-trained employees lying to get business and not caring about your babies. Put the money you’d spend here into savings and apply for care credit.
title: They don’t care

text:
Attempted to submit a claim for a pae infection. After weeks of waiting, was "declined" because of missing documentation. After trying to get more info through the chatbot, was able to get a person who told me more documentation was needed about the start of the episode. I explained that all vet notes from the first visit related to the episode until the infection resolved were shared...so my case was reopened. 2 weeks later I was just informed that my claim was again declined because I didn't demonstrate that my pet had a recent check-up (prior to the infection). There was no mention that this was necessary in the instructions to submit the claim. And again - instead of "declining" just ask me to provide the proof of check up...I would have gladly done so.

Bottom line - feels like they're doing everything NOT to collaborate..just want to avoid paying

Addendum - after multiple back-and-forths with Fetch Associates I was able to get my claim approved. My review, however, is less about the end result and more about the experience. It would have been so much more collaborative (helpful) for Fetch to reach out to tell me they needed more information, instead of notifying me that my claim was 'Rejected' and forcing me to reach out to them to better understand why and what was required to fix it ('Reject' at Fetch appears to not be a final decision...more like "Rejected...for now")

text:
DON'T USE FETCHPET. They are the absolute worst. Firstly, they are nearly impossible to speak with. Their chatapp...AI, not a person capable of navigating any actual issue. Their phone line? It will hang up on you at almost every turn with automated responses (that are not up to date with your account). Be prepared to call back 3-5 times before you figure out which selections might actually get you to a person. And, by the way, you might only be able to leave a VM even if you do find the right selection. Most importantly, be prepared to have a difficult-to-navigate process from start to finish. Over the last half year I have submitted over $4k of valid claims and, despite having their highest level of coverage, only received less than $800 with no explanation of why. Before FetchPet took over Petplan, it was perfectly easy to see what was accepted, rejected, and in process. Now, whether on their app or website, it's nearly impossible to tell what's been reimbursed, what hasn't, and how to rectify it so your plan can actually be put to proper use. I have spent literal months navigating their 'customer service' to have a single check resent to the correct address (yet to be done), to have claims properly processed following a car accident that left me unable to do so until after their standard submittal time (it was agonizing and lengthy to provide them with all the information they required), and to now continue to follow up on why only 20% of my claims have resulted in received reimbursement. They clearly do not want it to be simple or easy to receive what you are owed.

I’d like to add that their team has left the below standard message before I’ve received a reply to my most recent email or voicemail that were left before this review. So yet further demonstration of what they prioritize.
title: RUN FROM FETCHPET

text: easy claim filing and once settled fast payment
title: Vet Bills are expensive

text: Fetch has been really great with handling the claims for my cat Harvey who became really ill with Pancreatitis and has had to also have several visits after a stay at the veterinary hospital.  I have had the insurance since 2017 and had never had to file any claims until recently.  However, when I did file the claims, they were processed promptly and with no real issues other than wanting records clear back to 2018 (so they had a complete medical history which is reasonable).  My rates are going up by almost 39% for the renewal which is find kind of steep even with a higher deductible.  On the other hand, my cat is a senior cat and the insurance has paid for itself with vet bills for my cat's recent illness.  Word of advice -- make sure that you have your pet examined by the vet for an annual check up each year -- not just when sick or have an injury.  If not, it is likely that claims will not be paid if they do not have records of the most recent examination.  Seems that some people are confused, surprised, and even angry about this when they sign up and get upset when they will not pay.  However, it is outlined in the policy documents (which should be read carefully -- especially related to pre-exisiting conditions).  If this is done, they are great about paying your claims with the exception of prescription food/pill pockets, nail trims, wellness exams/vaccinations, etc.  This type of insurance is primarily for major illnesses when vet bills can climb from hundreds to thousands of dollars in a matter of days if your pet becomes unexpectedly ill or injured.  It really helps to get some money back after a stressful situation and is a relief that you can get the proper care for your pet without having to choose between your finances or the wellbeing/life of the pet that you love. It would be nice if pet insurance would offer paying vets directly after your deductible is met similar to human insurance -- rather than paying it all up front yourself.

text:
Fetch insurance is at it again. This time instead of trying to wiggle out of playing valid claims or running me through unnecessary hoops like getting RX for syringes, they simply just upped the premium >50% just like that, without any reason or context. Calling them, they claimed it's because "factors have changed", but refused to provide any detailed reasons as to what factors have changed. The only thing that changes is that the cat actually needed treatment, and they actually had to pay. Of course now I have a pet with "preexisting condition", which THEY KNOW, so they allow themselves to blackmail for 50% more this year (and who knows how much next?). In short: Fetch will insure your pet, as long as they don't get sick. Then they will just roll the costs over to you, because that's how they roll. I wouldn't trust Fetch long-term to not continue acting in bad faith and in the best interest of their bottom line rather than their customers and their pets.

Update after Fetch response: I did try to contact your support, and your representative were unable or unwilling to provide detailed reasoning behind a 50% increase in premium. To your point- I have been paying A VERY expensive premium for many years, on the expectation that if my got sick, it would have been worth it. I did not expect my insurance company to underhandedly try and extort me for 50% premium increase when my pet needed treatment. The way you do business is not customer-friendly, and everyone considering your insurance should know how you conduct yourself.
title: Price jacking / blackmail

text: They have paid all claims. Support and sales are polite and well educated. If you are okay with the cost of dog health insurance, then this is a good company to go with. I did some digging, and the cost is similar across different insurance companies when you compare apples to apples. The one thing to keep in mind, and this is across all companies, is that whatever conditions were treated under one policy will become pre-conditions with a different underwriter. So effectively you are choosing an insurer for the duration as the other companies will not provide coverage for anything related to past claims which took place under a different one. Another lesser-known fact is that once you decrease the level of coverage you cannot increase it.  So if you have unlimited 90% refund and change it to 10K 80%, you will not be able to go back. Additionally, premiums rise with veterinary costs and with the age of your pet. I'm told it is based on breed, dog's age, geographic area, and claims in that area (not the history of your particular dog). Fetch has discounts if you have no claims in the previous year, or in the previous 2 years. The discount is substantial. All companies, as far as I can tell are about the same regarding these things. We have had Fetch for 6-7 years for different pets.
title: Been with Fetch for 6 years and 5 dogs

I have this insurance since they were Pet Plan, it had been amazing! I have a 11yo golden retriever with multiple skin masses, he had surgeries the last years and they had covered always. Fetch helped during the whole process approving all the procedures. I don't know what would have done to get that money in that short time. I am glad I've been paying the premium all this years. It has been expensive but It was worth it. They also respond in a good time. After you send all the documents of each procedure they send you the reimbursement in around a week. 
I was not so happy with the increases every year, they increased my premium a high% every year and without noticed. I know it might be due to the procedures and high risk of illness of my baby. However, at the end, is paying off. 
Highly recommended!

text: Fetch reimbursed my Cat's emergency pancreatitis claims with no issues at all - very quickly actually.  First time that I ever had to file a claim. The only peeve I have is the claim calculation when you still need to meet the deductible. I discovered it is calculated by taking the total amount of the claim, multiplied by your co-pay deduction first (say 10%), then the deducible amount is deducted after rather than vice versa.  This means that you actually pay more, and they pay less - this is kind of sneaky in my opinion.  All in all, this insurance has been great for my pet.

text:
I have had my dog, Iggy insured with health insurance with Pet Plan/ Fetch by the Dodo for over 10 years. I had never filed a claim until last year. My premium started at around $200.00 ( year 1) to now $1300.00, which is to be expected because of Iggy' age. I purchased it with a $450.00 Deductible at with a 20% co insurance. I sent the proper information to them and they agreed to pay. Recently I made a new claim for an ER visit for a Paw issue. My 13 1/2 year old Labradoodle could not walk.The Vet visit went well.  The bill was for $596.63, the agreed to pay $27.30. PLEASE BE AWARE OF HOW THEY COMPUTE HOW THEY PAY A CLAIM. The 20% Co pay is on the whole amount EVEN the amount of the deductible (in my case $450.00), the funds they would never pay in the first place. They are considering that deductible amount in the final payment. Like as if they paid from it. MOST human health insurance policies pay at a full reimbursement rate in my case $450.00 AFTER the deductible.
    Claim amt:                 $596.63
    Deductible:                $450.00
     Total:                         $146.63
  80% reimbursement     $117.31

$117.31 vs. $27.30
Now if Iggy has to go back for the same issue they will pay on all new dollars spent @ 80%. Just be aware on small claims they go out of their way to pay smaller. They are a Closely owned private company. They could change this easily. 
This insurance will serve you on the larger claims.


If you read in their response they stated:

 Pet insurance is not the same as human health insurance.

THAT STATEMENT IS FALSE. However, it is true for Fetch by the Dodo insurance. There are some pet insurance companies that treat your pet just like a human. I consider IGGY as important as any human in my life.
title: BE AWARE:Tricky reimbursement rules

text: My 11 year old little girl kitty Abbie, was diagnosed with Hyperthyroidism in Dec 2022.  Her prognosis was very good but the treatment cost was not cheap.  Having Pet Plan (now Fetch) made the decision easier.  Her treatment (I 131) took 4 months to be scheduled.  It was done on 4/3/2023.  She is doing very well now.  I did not understand at the time that there is a 90 day window to submit claims.  I waited till after Abbie's treatment, then submitted all the invoices at once.  My claims were all denied for being over 90 days.  I then called in on 4/20/2023 for an explanation.  The representative I spoke with was not very helpful.  She told me she would look into the situation and call me back shortly.  After waiting 4 hrs I called back.  This time I spoke with Tattianna Smith.  Tattianna reviewed my claim and understood exactly what was happening.  She explained my mistakes and stayed on the line while I refiled.  She then confirmed that my claim was now filed correctly.  I was good to go.  So much so, that 24 hrs later, I received an email from Fetch that my claim was approved and the payment is on its way.  I can not commend Tattianna enough.  She is a very knowledgeable and wonderful representative for Fetch.  Thank you.
title: It Depends on the Representative

text:
My experience with my customer service representative, Anne Wheitsel was outstanding! Anne was able to address all of my questions and concerns. She was extremely patient with me and went above and beyond. She didn’t rush me in anyway and even looked up statistics on the breed of my dog, Harry to help me further understand and decide what policy would be best for Harry. 

Anne is such a delight to speak with.  We even exchanged stories of our pets together, which was so nice as I got to know her and her fur baby on a more personal level. She related to everything I discussed with her and the conversation flowed so nicely! So many times, calls seem so scripted, but not with Anne. Very genuine and extremely knowledgeable. 

Anne made my call experience to Fetch such a positive one. She is truly an asset to Fetch! 

Thank you, Anne for everything! 

-Heather and Harry LaBarbara
title: Amazing experience and superb Customer Service thanks to Anne!

text: Easy to use app that streamlines submitting claims. Also easy to get someone on the phone if you need to actually talk to a friendly person. Direct Deposit option to get your money deposited into your account. Overall very easy, straight forward, and user friendly. Would highly recommend!

text: Fetch has been excellent for us. Our dog Thea had a gastrointestinal illness and needed care. Fetch was easy to deal, with we submitted our claim online with very little paperwork and we were reimbursed promptly by direct deposit. Fantastic peace of mind for us. We would highly recommend.

text: Paid for a policy that went into effect the day I had a vet appointment scheduled. My pet required extra testing and medication. I came home to see an email from Fetch by Dodo that even though the policy was in effect, I couldn’t submit a claim for another 15 days. This info wasn’t made clear until the day the policy technically started. Be wary of any company that hides important stipulations in the fine print.
title: Shady practices

text: Really disappointed in this company now.  I gave them a 5 start review back in September, but need to change my rating.  My rates just went up.  47% increase for one cat and 21% increase for the other.  They are the same age.  Even though the rep told me they do not increase premiums based on claims, she then proceeded to tell me that the 47% increase was because that cat DID have a claim so I lost my 30% rate "discount".  In addition she said the State of Washington care rate has gone up.  WOW!  AND, they recently denied my claims for the other cat.  I will be shopping for a new insurance company.  Ever since this one changed to their new name and now have a new insurer, it seems that their CARE has gone downhill.  Very sad to see.
title: WHAT happened to this company?

text:
Fetch does a great job reimbursing claims….however, if there are ANY issues, it is a little difficult to get the support needed in a timely or reasonably simple manner. 
For example, the chat support operates like a maze in a phone menu. Trying to discover the email my vet should use in order to provide additional documentation turns into a frustrating research project as I’m directed through a prescribed catalog of subjects and webpages to visit before finally being allowed to make contact with a human to ask a very simple question. 
Also, I’m human. I make mistakes. I don’t proofread well enough sometimes. Please make it easier to edit or even cancel a submitted claim. That was the reason for my first foray into your chatbot maze about two weeks ago.
title: Need quicker access to human customer support

text:
Hello, 

We have had a wonderful time with Fetch pet insurance. We got a puppy back in November 2022. We took him to the vet as a puppy and he received a clean bill of health. A couple months later we were playing in the yard when our puppy vomited and collapsed. He stopped breathing and his heart stopped as well. Luckily my boyfriend was able to give him chest compressions and bring him back to life. Our puppy has had to go to several follow up vet appointments since including a cardiologist visit and Fetch Pet Insurance has covered exactly what the policy promised it would cover. I highly recommend this company, they have been great to work with.
title: Great Pet Insurance

text:
They cover the basics, didn't however cover my dogs referral from my vet to a certified physio clinic because although everyone was trained and certified in that area not all of them were qualified vets and so apparently that does not qualify so that meant hundreds being spent on top of the insurance so it's worth really looking into what they do and don't cover. 
They also take a long time to reimburse any claims although to be fair they do cover alot overall from a vet visit and eventually you will get reimbursed.
 They also recently put the monthly cost up by $7 so hoping that doesn't continue to climb.
Overall I'd say they are okay but wish I had put more research into others before committing
title: Not bad but not great

text:
I spoke with Tattianna Smith at Fetch by The Dodo Pet Insurance today.  I feel compelled to write about my experience.  I have been going through a very difficult month as my precious, darling cat, Tilly, has been quite ill.  
 I needed to file claims for her hospitalizations, etc., and having had little sleep due to worry and staying with her in the hospital, my capacity to submit my claims is diminished.
 Tatiana stayed on the phone with me (as I intermittently burst into tears) and consoled me and patiently walked me through the steps for submission.  Not only did she do that, she also sent messages to the 3 vets involved to make sure that all invoicing is received.
 This is customer service at it's very best! Truly above and beyond the call of duty.
 Additionally, I called back to find out how to give a review, and Tracy, who answered the phone was incredibly sweet and kind as I again became emotional. 
 I am incredibly fortunate have found Fetch and am very grateful for this experience.
Sincerely, Susan Pinkus

text: Our beloved Drew was diagnosed with cancer last year. It was totally out of the blue & devastating. We began treatment with radiation,  chemo & an array of medications. We kept him happy & healthy for 5 months...until the treatment stopped working & the cancer progressed. Through it all, our insurance was a godsend. The treatment was very costly,  but petplan covered 70% of the costs. Besides that, they made processing our claims & getting paid so easy. They made a horrible situation just a bit easier financially. I feel for people with sick pets & no insurance. The decisions you are forced to make are unthinkable. I would suggest to anyone with pets, get petplan insurance. Hopefully you'll never need it,  but if you do, it will be a blessing. It was for us.❤️
title: Beloved Drew

text: This has been the worst experience!!  After almost 10 years of paying for TWO dogs (approximately $18,360), we file ONE claim (for $1800) in all that time and have gotten NOTHING BUT THE RUN AROUND from this company!  They asked for medical records over the last two years, fine, no problem. Then, they wanted the 2 previous years before that, fine. Then, two years before that! We were filing a claim for 2 cracked molars and the surgery required to remove the teeth. So, NO, dental is NOT covered, as the policy states. Our dog also had an enlarged prostate. In order to fix it, he had to be neutered. Didn't cover that either. Fetch is a complete waste of time and money!  In the meantime, our dog passed away from an unknown illness. Only THEN, when we cancelled BOTH policies attempt to give us $180 and some change. GO ELSEWHERE!!!!!!!
title: This has been the worst experience!! …

text: Fetch is unfortunately engaged in very high annual premium increases, at least as far as we are concerned.  If you are with Fetch be very careful when you get any renewal notice.  Fetch will take "factors" including your zip code and may increase your annual premium substantially.  There are other very credible, reliable pet insurers who are less costly than Fetch, and I would venture to say as competent, gracious and all the other good things.  In my view, just me folks, but I consider Fetch to be a rip off because of very high premiums, increasing yearly at a dramatic rate.  I did call to talk it out with a customer rep who was courteous but not helpful; the only thing that worked is cancel and go with Spot.

text:
2.5.
The company is fine. The coverage is good with a decent deductible, but it takes so long for them to review claims. I've submitted a claim nearly a month ago and there's been little to no progress. I've never had insurance claims take this long for myself, I don't understand why it takes forever for pets with Fetch.

I contacted Fetch on 3/17 to discuss my account. It was a call I didn’t want to make but I had to. To my relief, I was greeted and help by probably the most friendly and helpful customer service person I have ever encountered. Denise Ariale understood my financial worries and helped me see that I could still afford to keep coverage on my two pets. While doing so, she was so friendly and personable. She truly cared about me and my pets’ well being. I thought I was going to have to give up coverage all together.
   I am retired now but when I was working, I was a manager in the customer service industry. Denise’s manner, knowledge, understanding, and problem solving ability were everything I used to look for in an employee. These are indeed very rare traits to find. Hang on to her!!!

text:
I have Fetch since August last year, so far I have sent 5 claims, 3 last year and 2 this year, none has pay me any benefits, the first claims was for a skin condition and allergy my dog had,  unfortunately they said it’s a pre-existing condition, the second claim the same they recognize the problem but the benefits when towards the deductible $300. Which by the way took over 4 weeks plus aggravation since they don’t ask for documentation right away ( looks like they are back up) but they ask for the same records (SOAP) again and again, their wed site uploader does not support “ heavy” documents ( no more than a page at the time) which can be unbearable, since they ask for the soap which can be between 5/6 or more pages depending on the time frame of services. 
The second time I have claim was for again allergies but this time my dog was giving a new medication which was expensive $189,  they didn’t cover the medication, on their benefits list they said they cover medications but no this one? 
So I decided to cancel this insurance, they simply don’t want to cover, pay for benefits they simply will used any excuse not to pay. 
Im done with this company.

text: This stuff is a scam. I first insured my dog with Fetch 3 years ago. He was 6 at the time, and in very healthy shape. He went for his annual every year, and had had no major issues. But, as he is 9 now, and age is catching up to him, we've had some issues crop up since becoming insured. I was under the impression that my dog would be covered for these issues, however, the representatives at this company are clearly instructed to find any even slight indication in veterinary records to deny your claim. In three years, I have paid thousands of dollars to this company in 'coverage', but I have not received a penny in benefits, as they will hack up your bill to the point where they only cover $11 of a multi hundred dollar bill, and therefore, you can never meet your deductible $500 in order to receive benefits. They will find any little thing in your pet's entire vet record to hack away at those benefits to ensure you receive nothing. I just input my latest claim today and I am looking forward, because it's just laughable now, to receiving the denial email that explains that of my $440 claim only $10 was covered so that's just $10 of my $500 deductible teehheeheee. They'll never pay you anything. Go somewhere else - trust me. I have no idea how this company has generated so many good reviews, but it may have been from before it was acquired by "the dodo", because I will say the assistance was better in the first few months of coverage and their agents were friendly. Now their agents just sound annoyed with questions, eager to tell you cheerily all about how they denied your claim and why (bs reasons). This company has not paid out any claim in three years. I would have been better off taking the monthly cost and putting it in a savings acct that I controlled, instead, I just paid an extra couple of grand to some greedy middle man so that they could act dodgy, no oversight, deny everything by only covering chump change on each bill, and offer no other assistance. DO NOT GET THESE GUYS. GO ELSEWHERE.
title: This stuff is a scam

text:
Edit on March 8: they reached out to me by phone and, after I explained the situation, acknowledged that the website does seem misleading, and they'd look into my feedback.

Their website's description of what documents are needed for a claim is misleading to say the least.

They say on their website that the medical records they need are "Detailed medical records, including from your pet’s most recent checkup (a vet visit unrelated to your pet getting sick or hurt)". (Trustpilot doesn't allow me to post link, but the specific webpage is titled "Your guide to filing claims.")

But in reality, they also ask for the records from the visit which the claim is for, i.e. the visit that happened exactly because my pet was sick. And their customer service agent explicitly confirmed this to me, without explaining why it works differently than what their website says.

If they were clear and consistent upfront, I probably would have no problem with providing the medical records for every visit. But now I feel I was lied to, and I have serious doubt whether I can trust them when I need them. I may need to shop around for other pet insurances.
title: Misleading and inconsistent website

text: On Feb 6th I posted a negative review about Fetch pet insurance as they refused to pay my claim for my cat Charlie’s tooth resorption consultation with a board certified dentist which was recommended by my vet who felt the situation warranted a specialist. text:
I had just signed up for Fetch insurance and today was the day the "policy waiting period" ended. I had read through the policy terms & conditions multiple times before enrolling, and then again today before I reached out to customer service for further clarification. I simply wanted to know if my pup would be covered against future diseases where vaccinations were available for those diseases, but not required. 

Anyone who has a dog knows that there are "core vaccinations" (DHPP) that your dog receives annually, but I was questioning if the optional vaccinations (lyme, lepto, bordetella, etc.,) were required to ensure future coverage against those diseases. 

I reached out to Fetch via live chat and a customer service rep named Rushti had a very difficult time giving me a straight answer. I had to repeat my questions multiple times before he understood what I was asking, and every answer he gave me seemed like it was copied and pasted from the policy terms & conditions. His responses were general, extremely vague and not at all helpful. I was trying to ensure that we followed their policy and covered all our bases, to make the most out of our insurance. 

I still don't understand if the optional vaccinations are required to ensure future coverage for the related diseases. I was worried that if, for example, I didn't get my pup the lyme vaccination and he was exposed to and diagnosed with lyme disease in the future, that he would not be covered because he did not receive the lyme vaccination. My pup is on flea and tick medication but I didn't know if that would suffice, and neither did Rushti. He kept reiterating that "as long as it's not a pre-existing condition, Lyme disease is covered" and to "file a claim and let the claim adjuster confirm my coverage" but that didn't answer my original question about the optional vaccines. I also don't understand why I needed to submit a claim to confirm my coverage? Then as I was typing my response, Rushti asked if I had anymore questions and then abruptly ended our chat. That was a pathetic move and extremely unprofessional.

Overall, the customer service I experienced was awful and I would cancel my insurance policy just because of that. But I will also be cancelling it due to the fact that there are so many grey areas and not enough clarity as to what us pet parents need to do to ensure our beloved pets are 100% covered. I don't like that this was a hard question for customer service to answer, I truly thought it would be a simple "yes" or "no" type of deal. Now, I believe that if I had to reach out to Fetch for their help, they would be unable to help me. They would for sure reiterate their policy but not elaborate in detail, and that's just plain wrong.

Anyone who's looking to do what's best for your pets, just do yourself a favour and avoid scams like this. You're better off opening up a savings account for your pet(s), don't leave your hard-earned money with Fetch. They don't deserve it.
title: I had just signed up for Fetch…

text: After the loss of a cat and elderly dog in 18 months and the expensive emergency vet fees we decided to sign our other pets up for an insurance plan. We did a lot of research and settled on Fetch. We currently have 4 cats (including our new kitten) and we just adopted a rescue dog. Our kitten is super active and even after doing everything we could to kitten-proof our house he somehow managed to break his hip - we aren’t sure how but think he climbed up the outside of the stairs and fell from 12 feet up when he couldn’t turn around - I caught him doing this the day before but grabbed him before he got too high, and hadn’t yet figure out how to prevent this. I had installed netting along the inside of the stairs in fear of him slipping through the rails but didn’t account for that 2.5” overhang on the outside. So our baby cat had to have very expensive emergency vet care followed by surgery. Fetch was amazing and it only took about 2 weeks for the reimbursement to show up in my account with zero issues. We had used it once previously for one of our cats having nonspecific gastro issues and they were just as responsive then. I can’t believe we went so many years without pet insurance but I would not be without it again. Pay attention to the requirements and ensure you have a yearly visit in your pet’s records, you will need that to make a claim. I find the app easy to use and will recommend Fetch to everyone!

text:
I did detailed research on various pet insurance companies and Fetch offered the most coverage for the most affordable price. Of course you never know how good a company is until you need to file a claim; which I did in November. I had a $1600 claim for my dog swallowing something and it causing an obstruction; filed the claim on 11/15 and the reimbursement was in my account on 11/23! I was truly amazed!There were no questions asked and no battling; everything was covered, minus my deductible and my 10% responsibility. Communication was good, received a couple texts keeping me informed during the week. 
I have colleagues that have recommended other companies, I will read the terms and do quotes just to appease my curiosity,  but they have not come close to the affordability of Fetch and the services they cover!

Every time I try to make a claim, somehow my deductible hasn't been met, even though it's the end of the year and I have already paid through the deductible.

All were paid quickly; however, the company has streamlined the process over time to reduce the requisite paperwork so that it is very easy to file a claim.  I don’t think the process could be improved.  If you have a big dog, I would highly recommend pet insurance—two of the claims were for cruciate ligament surgeries amounting to around $15,000.

I really appreciated these ladies help during this stressful time and I'm so grateful that I have coverage with Fetch for my fur-baby.  12/26/22- Lauren

title: Emergencies and my Fur-baby

text: At the very end of October, my little dog had surgery to remove a large mass.  His surgery was successful. Afterwards, I contacted Fetch to find out what documents were necessary in order to file a claim. The representative was very nice and told me exactly what I needed to submit. A couple of weeks later, after my dog’s stitches were removed, I was given all of the necessary papers from my vet and I sent them in to Fetch.  They kept me posted as to when they received the papers and they also let me know the progress of the review of the claim. A very short time later, I was reimbursed. I was so surprised at how quickly this was taken care of.
title: Healthy Dog, Happy Human!

text:
Fetch replied to a previous review of mine and claimed that my dog had a preexisting condition that was before his wait period but the visit they claim he “showed signs” on. That submitted visit was actually for just a checkup and had nothing to do with his allergies or anything. Simply they gave him apoquel just as a preventative because he gets allergies and itchy ears. Nothing to do with his paws which is what he was seen for on the visit that I ACTUALLY submitted for. So fetch clearly will do anything to NOT pay or help out when they claim to “care” about your furbaby. This pet insurance is a SCAM just like any other insurance.


EDIT to reply: you need to stop lying to people by saying you care about animals when you wouldn’t have stipulations such as a “preexisting condition” that was not even the case. Also what I’m gathering is that you all wouldn’t consider it preexisting had I cropped the previous visit out? Y’all are trash.
title: Another review for a scam of insurance

text:
Fetch is a scam. They continued to charge us after we cancelled. We cancelled because the rate skyrocketed to over $2500 and the policy pays a maximum of $400 per illness. So it would be impossible to recover the premium unless my pet had 7 unrelated illnesses in one year. Absurd. We changed our credit card number to stop them from continuing to charge us and they somehow found the new number and kept charging us. We disputed the charges with our credit card company and they didn’t challenge our dispute until two years later, when they suddenly charged us for three years’ worth of insurance premiums totaling over $8k. The company changed hands (from petplan to fetch) and they claim not to have saved the recorded call during which I cancelled in 2020. So the credit card company took their side (they did not give us written confirmation of the cancellation-it was only on the call which I did not record myself) and in 2022 they made us pay $5000 for policies that were supposedly in effect for 2020 and 2021. You have 90 days to submit a claim, so there’s no way we could have derived a single penny’s worth of benefit from those premiums. Pure scam.

Yes, I spoke with customer service. In answer to my question about why I would get charged $8000 in a single year to insure one cat, the rep said, “If we are able to charge you, we will.”  I think that pretty much sums up the company.
title: Fetch is a scam

text: I really like Fetch for our pet insurance. We've had it since July 2020, and while we didn't need to use it until this past October/November, oh boy, it really saved us to have. We have the policy of $250 deductible and $5,000 policy, up to 90% reimbursement. My Chihuahua mix tore her ACL and had to see a specialist and then get surgery, and we are so thankful we had Fetch as we could get the estimate for the surgery preapproved. Keep in mind though, that you must pay the cost of whatever it is upfront and then Fetch will reimburse you, so it's important to have a credit card on hand until you get the reimbursement. I also appreciate their timely customer service. All in all, we're pleased with Fetch as it saved us from having to pay a total of $4900 for her specialist appointment and surgery, so we only had to pay ~$200 out of pocket, not including the $250 deductible. Thank you, Fetch!

text: I am approaching my 10th year of Fetch coverage on my pack of beagles. And in that time the coverage has been excellent and affordable for the odd pair of ingested underwear, pulled muscle or constipation - typical hound afflictions! But a few months ago, I took my male Hank to the ER for what I assumed was a worsening case of kennel cough, to find out that he was in congestive heart failure, and my world was turned upside down. Amongst the tears and fears and angst of getting all of the follow up appointments made and medications accurately dosed and trying to picture life without my best boy dog - one thing I never had to worry about was coverage. I was quickly reimbursed for my claims for the ER, the veterinary cardiologist, the prescription medications, even the prescribed over-the-counter supplements like fish oil and ubiquinol. Having the flexibility of being able to seek out every last shred of care possible for my dog, without having to worry about the cost, is beyond priceless to me and his beagle sister. I'll never go without Fetch on my hounds or any future furry members of my family!
title: Relief for mom's heart during CHF journey!

text:
If I could give zero stars, I would. Refused reimbursement. I also sent a complaint to BBB of the same issue. My cat received treatment from June  2022 to August 2022 totaling 1234.39. They denied until vet sent records dating all the way back to 2013 when they were previously Pet Plan USA. With $350 annual deductible, and then 90% reimbursement, that comes out to 795.95. They then reviewed all the information my vet sent, and only reimbursed $108.91. I called the cancellation line to cancel, but they said they would work with me, so I didn't at the time. I called again about only being reimbursed 108.91 and didn't hear back, I am owed 687.04 and if I had known, I would not have continued the policy, and was charged 86.24 for period Sept to Dec, which I would like a refund. 

When it was Pet Plan USA, they would've sent the reimbursement check within 5 business days.

Note: this was not verified as they require uploading very sensitive documents such as driver's license.

text:
Very disappointing! In the beginning of our insurance (first year with Fetch), I submitted claims for our dogs as we had their full exams done per Fetches request and I assumed they would cover some portion of it. They did not-which is fine and not my issue. 

Fast-forward to renewal, a year later, and we’ve have ZERO claims processed or paid out (besides the initial one that they said, yeah no, doesn’t qualify that’s a routine service). I want to increase one of our dogs coverage but they’re refusing to let me. I have to stick with what we have—FOREVER because I submitted one claim that went nowhere!

They may be rated well, they may cover a lot but they, just like all other pet insurance companies will find some way to screw you. 

It’s extremely disappointing because I did extensive research before buying coverage and its sad that every single company INCLUDING FETCH BY THE DODO scams customers and is just a funnel for money with extensive exclusions and BS rules.
