text: Fetch is great! The streamlined electronic claim submission and digital app have made the claims process very easy. They send timely texts to let you know where your claim is in processing. So much simpler than how Pet Plan processed years ago. Our almost 9yo JRT mix has been insured since we adopted her. If anyone knows about JRTs you will understand the peace of mind insurance brings. The complaints I've read seem to be from folks who don't understand how claims are processed. Unlike people medical insurances, Fetch starts off considering 80% of the bill (the first 20% is our responsibilty to pay) then the deductible that you chose when you signed up is subtracted. After that, what's left that has been found insurable is paid to you. Direct deposit is the best! When choosing pet insurance deductibles are important to understand. I worked out the numbers for myself and here goes: a 80/20 plan with a $300 deductible will not repay you anything until you've spent over $375 but they will apply the appropriate charges to your deductible for that condition. Then if further treatment is needed for that, your deductible is met and allowable charges will be paid at 80%. With an 80/20 $500 deductible plan, you wouldn't get anything back until your bills submitted for that condition exceed $625. Submit all of your bills to apply to the deductible in case of future claims for the same condition. It's very simple. The math works out! Choose wisely when you sign up and you'll be very happy.
title: Fetch is great

text:
This company is so unprofessional and misleading... we submitted 3 claims that were all denied in writing outlining 'your claim does not meet your chosen deductible of $400 at this time, therefore no payment will be made.'
A little while later, we followed-up to look at enhancing our insurance plan and were told that because payments made to the previous 3 claims noted above, they cannot make any changes to our plan.

We were very surprised to hear they had made payments because...
- we have 3 letters from 'Petplan' stating each claim was denied
- no transaction record for any payment received
- BUT we have each transaction record we paid to the vet

When we asked them to clarify what payments they're referring to, they said they paid the deductible for each of the claims. Now we're really confused since who would they be paying the deductible in question to since it was not us BUT only Fetch/Petpaln.  In essence they are only paying themselves for each of the claims we made and more interestingly, recorded each deductible payment as a claim against our policy even though they denied all of them??!!!
After 5 years and nearly 9k in premiums, this is one company that I would recommend you not 'TRUST' for your pets needs
title: This company is so unprofessional and…

text:
The absolute worst customer service and company. Firstly the supervisor who talked to me on the phone was a horrible person, condescending and mean. 
This company will look for any ways to deny your claim reimbursement. Go for any other company than this even if it means a higher premium because you’ll be sure to receive your services, not with Fetch. 
I recently submitted TWO claims, 2 days apart for my pet Joey. They reviewed it initially and asked me for additional medical documents which I submitted. I submitted additional 9 records, his history for the prior 2 years, that’s what they asked. My pet is a 4 year old young dog who has no medical conditions and has been very healthy. Even the medical records and blood work I submitted from the first day of the claim stated he was overall very healthy but was suffering from stomach issues due to either foreign body ingestion or extreme care of gastroenteritis. 

Their 15 day thing is incorrect. I had to literally be on their chat every day to get an update just for both of my claims which are days apart to be denied. Reason: 
“ This policy does not cover:

mm. Any amount if you failed to satisfy, or comply with, the conditions set forth in the GENERAL CONDITIONS, CARE FOR YOUR PET (VII.6) section of this policy. Including, but not limited to condition b. if your pet has not been examined by a veterinarian within six (6) months prior to the effective date of the policy, you must arrange to have your pet examined at your own expense within thirty (30) days of the effective date of the policy. Any medical condition(s), clinical sign(s), behavioral disorder(s) or illness(es) observed or recorded during the first exam, and all costs associated therewith, are automatically excluded from coverage. Your failure to have a first exam of your pet may void the policy. If voided, the policy premium will be refunded. Additionally, any conditions that are related to, caused by, or resulting from medical condition(s), clinical sign(s), behavioral disorder(s) or illness(es) observed or recorded at the first exam performed after the effective date of the policy are also excluded from coverage” 

I talked to customer service and the supervisor is literally one of the worst people I’ve talked to like do you really have no heart for pet parents and I explained that one of his exams was in October 2021, a comprehensive exam from Banfield that stated he was completely healthy. They refused to take that into account because it was not exactly within the 6 month mark. I cited the policy later which clearly says that your policy needs to have 6 month prior record or an examination within 30 days or else it may be voided and your premium reimbursed. I had been paying from May- October for two pets and they never sent me any email regarding this issue and I was like my policy should have just been voided if these are your rules and why was I allowed to pay for so long without any objection from your end. 
My understanding of the whole situation is that they did this so that they can find any loophole to deny my claim, research Reddit and many customers have been so unhappy with their policies. The supervisor should firstly not even be allowed to be in a customer service role because he was the worst. They won’t reimburse my premium or approve my claim. 
I’m absolutely distraught because I trusted this dumb company and I would rather pay a higher premium than deal with this company, go with lemonade or healthy paws if you would actually like your pet to be covered and not deal with the worst customer service. Horrible horrible in all ways
title: The absolute worst customer service and…

text: My beloved 9 year old cat somehow punctured his neck, and after being unable to get him out from hiding under the bed, I realized he had blood on the fur under his neck. The puncture developed into an infected abscess that burst causing all the blood. Very scary experience, but thanks to a compassionate vet and a pet insurance policy from Fetch by the Dodo, we got through it.  All I needed to do was get my cat’s last examination history and invoices for services performed by the vet and upload the documents to Fetch and all the claims for several visits were handled totally electronically.  It was fairly easy to initially learn the claims submission process, and everything I sent in was immediately acknowledged and swiftly assigned to a claims examiner.  Not only were the claims processed expeditiously but by providing them with my bank information, my claims reimbursement was directly deposited into my checking account on a very timely basis.  Fetch lets you choose an initial deductible amount per illness and the percentage of reimbursement, which in my case was 90% per visit, which allows you to tailor your coverage and premium amounts. No nightmarish conflicts, just simple fair reimbursement for wonderful professional care.  I would gladly recommend Fetch to anyone that wants to protect their pet by getting quality medical care insurance coverage.
title: Outstanding Claims Handling

text: Don't explain anything. Always look for the way to pay you the least. If you submit one claim, you can never update or change your policy. You deductible is per renewal period year, not annual so make sure you pay attention to that. text:
Fetch doesn’t care about you or your animal. I’m sure all insurance companies aren’t great but we’ve had this one since the day we adopted Loki. He was a 7 month old rescue and they have said literally everything is a pre- -existing condition and even though we pay every month they pay for nothing and it's been 2 years now. 

Our most recent claim was denied. It was for 2k and they said it was due to him having lupus - he had lumps all over his under belly and so the vet wanted to do a biopsy - it turned out it was a bunch of ingrown hairs due to him going into remission and all his hair growing back (really something to celebrate).

They also found out that the problem plaguing him wasn't lupus (though that's what he has) but it was an infection that had caused the lesions we'd been fighting to begin with. But none of that mattered because their only goal is to take your money and not pay anything out ever. 

They aren’t humane. They don’t call you back. They don’t work with you. It’s just a money grubbing company and the worst part is on the other end of all this is a poor, helpless dog who just needed some love and attention. If you’re going to be an insurance company for animals have a freaking heart

We'd go somewhere else but as he has a pre-existing condition (for real now, not when we was fine at 7 months old when we adopted him and go the insurance the same minute) and so it will be just as bad if not more expensive. We are however looking into options.

Fetch responded to this but they only responded here. They never contacted me personally. They haven't said what I could do to help besides "have our vet send more paperwork" - not WHAT paperwork. And all his vets have sent a ton of paper. When we adopted Loki he just had a cyst on his toe and hair missing from his tail which we were told was due to stress / his previous life.  This response below is just aligned with all the previous BS they have spouted.
title: Find someone else, they are the WORST.

text: Unfortunately this insurance company like most is a scam. You have to meet a deductible FOR EACH ISSUE. For example if your pet has urinary issues it’s a $450 deductible for urinary issues before they even pay a lousy 80%. Now if say 2 months later your animal goes in for stool issues that’s a whole separate $450 deductible. Meanwhile it starts out cheap to pay per month but as your pet ages your policy increases. Our cat is 10 and we’re now paying $80 a month for them to cover basically nothing. Ridiculous wouldn’t recommend. You’re better saving that money every month so when an issue arises you can pay it yourself.
title: Unfortunately this insurance company…

text: I was a bit doubtful at first, because most insurance companies find any reason or excuse not to pay out for claims (I've heard from other people), so when it just happened that our cat got very sick and racked up a huge vet bill, I wasn't sure if Fetch will be there for us. But they were! Our kitty had gone through a URI, then a lung infection, then got diagnosed with Congestive heart failure and more heart problems. It was a very hard time for us... However, everything was covered according to the policy and no major issues. My only complaint is that I really had to track down historical documentation, although Fetch had all the information of my vets (location, numbers etc.) visits and they said they would fax or call for my cat's records, but it didn't really happen. I was hoping for a bit more customer service from that aspect, and it caused a bit of delays in my claims process, but once my records were sent they processed the payouts pretty fast! Thanks

title: I have this insurance for quite some…

text: This pet insurance company is not upfront about requirements. When you're enrolling in their program, they say that all that's required are the "soap" notes from a check-up/wellness visit within the past 6 months as these notes typically document all current and previous health concerns. I understand that they need this to check for pre-existing conditions. However, once you try to submit a claim, they will tell you that they now need the "soap" notes from every vet visit your pet has ever had. Depending on your vet, this can be a challenging task. I would be careful if you're considering Fetch and make sure that you have all notes from every vet visit. My vet also feels this company is not "user friendly" and prefers the insurance companies that simply provide a form for her to complete. Lastly, when I called to confirm the new documents required to submit a claim, the customer service representative was sarcastic, condescending, and rude. Needless to say that I will be shopping for new pet insurance.
title: This pet insurance company is not transparent.

text: I have policies for all 3 of my pets with Fetch and I am always so happy with their service.  If you have multiple pets insurance is a must, and Fetch does it right!  Big shout out to all the staff who answer all my calls and questions with diligence, patience and kindness.

text:
Great affordable insurance plans and it is nice to be able to cater to what you need for your pet(s) and personal finances.  We lucked out so far with our 2 dogs, but recently we have been treating one for bladder stones.  Right out the door after the first (and unexpected) appointment our deductible was met, and then some, so after sending in a claim, we had reimbursement less than a week later.  Super fast with claim reviews and results.  Definitely set up direct deposit for returns, because it is there the same day your claim gets approved.  The last claim I made, I received reimbursement literally less than 24 hours later.  The claim process is very simple and easy to use.  Just upload your vet bill along with the pet's medical history file and you’re done.

I would definitely recommend Fetch to others looking for pet insurance.
title: Affordable and Fast, Great Coverage

text:
Fetch has been a life saver for us! It started with a skin infection on our dog Wilson's nose that got completely out of hand. Fetch's customer service was responsive and patient when I contacted them in June 2022 about how to correctly file a claim and what sort of documentation they would require. 

Wilson then tore his cranial cruciate ligament (CCL) in his back left leg not even 2 full months later in August 2022 and ended up needing TPLO surgery that he received in September 2022. During his surgery they did a biopsy on his nose because it still hadn't cleared up after months with treatment. From the biopsy it turns out he also has an autoimmune disease which we are able to proceed with a dermatologist in regards to thanks to Fetch. 

We had to use half of what we had saved up to buy our first home for Wilson's surgery, post-op care (including rehabilitative physical therapy) and other issues that have come up around the same time, but thanks to Fetch we are able to get a majority of that back while getting Wilson the absolute best care.

We've had experience with a different pet insurance company with our previous dog that crossed rainbow bridge due to lymphoma and it was not a positive one. That experience led us to look for another pet insurance when we got Wilson which is when we found PetPlan which later became Fetch. Fetch has always managed to process our claims and reimburse us in about a week's time while our previous experience with the other pet insurance  company left us waiting months for reimbursement and updates on the status of where they were at with processing our claims for chemotherapy.

Our experience has been so positive that we have been recommending Fetch to all of our friends and family since Wilson's leg injury. Pet insurance is something that you hope you never have to use, but we are so thankful that we have it because when we needed it we had it and could do what was best for our dog's health.
title: Fetch has been a life saver for us!

text:
Thank goodness for Fetch! I just got a new kitten and thankfully because of the deal Fetch has with North Shore Animal League the 15 day wait period was waived, because on exactly day 14 the kitten tried to make a jump that was too big and hurt his back leg and wouldn't put any pressure on it. After spending a weekend in and out of ERs (because of course I was away from home when it happened and had to go to a different ER once I got home that had a surgeon I needed) I had bills for thousands of dollars. Fetch did as promised and reimbursed 80% which was such a life saver! 

Only reason I didn't give five stars was because of their policy with curable recurring conditions. My kitten had  a feline cold at the shelter that the shelter said was resolved. When I got home it was clear a week in that this wasn't actually the case so I went to a vet to get meds for the lingering cold. When I submitted that claim I found out it wasn't covered because of the policy and that it would have been better for me to never have submitted the claim at all informing them of the "second" cold because now instead of one year until a curable condition is covered again, it will be two years until its covered since he supposedly had a cold a second time, and that if he gets a third cold it will be considered incurable and never covered again. So it would have been better if I just never told them about the "second" cold at all so that he'd be covered for it again one year out instead of two.
title: Thank goodness for Fetch

title: Great experience with this company!

text:
Honestly, I've been really disappointed with Fetch's customer service, response time and functionality of the app + website. 

The app + website have had numerous log-in issues for over a year. Some of the reps I had worked with in trying to mend this would laugh and just say 'it is what it is and a lot of account are locked out' - not really helpful. It took nearly a year's time to be able to fully access and utilize my account due to technical errors on Fetch's end.

Regarding customer service - I've had claims denied that were clearly new issues. The issues I see here, stemmed from the ability to upload vet records without needing a claim submission. Also, it's unclear on where to upload your first base-line records or just anything that doesn't need an actual claim submission. Think vaccines and routine care. Also, the inability to access my account added to this debacle. Needless to say I've asked for a claim to be rereviewed and it's been over 40 days without an answer or real communication. You don't get to easily work with a claims specialist 1:1 for quick resolutions. 

Another frustrating piece is my cat was diagnosed with diabetes about 10-11 months after my plan had started ( 4 months ago now) and after repeated emails and chats I still haven't gotten an answer on if there are any brand restrictions on glucose monitors and other supplies. 

I do appreciate that Fetch covers exam fees for 'sick' visits but, with all of the above it makes dealing with a sick pet just so much more stressful. The worst part is, if you decide an insurance company isn't for you - you now likely have new issues that will become 'preexisting' if you choose to go elsewhere. So making your initial decision is really important. 

If you're looking for true customer service and a company passionate about your pets as much as you are, I would recommend going elsewhere. But, again my best piece of advice is to thoroughly do your homework on which insurance company is best for you as it's a commitment and not something you can easily change, especially if any new issues arise with your fur baby.
title: Choose wisely. Don't expect quick help.

text:
I have had this insurance from when it was called Pet Plan. It recently became Fetch. The customer service has always and still remains excellent. It’s very easy to submit a claim online or using the phone app. They text and email you the status of your claim every few days. It has typically taken 10 calendar days (at most) for me to get my claim approved. I have my debit card saved, so I get a direct deposit to my account the same day the claim is approved - instead of waiting for a check in the mail. 
They cover alternative treatments that other insurance companies don’t cover. They also cover the fee for a sick visit to the vet. I also like their chat feature online or in the app where you can speak to a representative and have your questions answered immediately. 
I honestly have no complaints. The whole claims process is stress free which is great because I don’t need any additional stress when my dog is ill. 
Also, you get a discount on your premium if your pet is a rescue, a therapy animal, or a service animal.
title: Covers a lot and the process is stress free

text: I got fetch shortly after getting my dog as a puppy just over two years ago. I wanted to make sure that if my dog ever got injured or sick she’d be able to have the necessary treatment without me worrying about the cost. In these two years I’ve had to use them twice for emergency vet visits, and each time Fetch was there to help. They covered everything in the exact way their policy states (for me it was 80% of the vet bill minus the deductible) and made the claim process extremely painless. I would recommend Fetch to all pet owners.

He resolved my issue and answered my questions.  Adam is indeed an asset to your company.  I always recommend Fetch (Pet Plan) to other pet parents!

text:
Signed up yesterday for two young dogs. Was astounded to find out that they immediately processed payments from my account, despite me being told that my first payment was due October 1, 2022.  The first payment date was confirmed on the email they sent (see below)
MASTERCARD (3968)
First billing date: 10/01/2022
Monthly premium: $C43.52
When I called this morning, was told that I had been told about the "down payment" (I wasn't) and about the first payment being due upon enrolling (I wasn't).  Supervisor who reviewed the phone call from yesterday obvious did not listen to entire conversation as she would have definitely heard myself and "Jeff" joking about a Sept 1 first payment and him confirming that no, my first payment was due October 1.

I have multiple insurance policies (including a current pet policy) and at no time have had to make a "down payment". Additionally, the premiums are always due the month following enrollment, which is what this policy says should happen, but did not.

No accountability for the difference in what I was told or what my policy states in writing. I have cancelled this policy and do not recommend using this USA company for your pet insurance needs.
title: This company is not accountable

text:
Honestly, loosing your fur baby is a painful experience, but dealing with Fetch from day one that I submitted my claims has been nothing but road blocks. 

Do not waste your money in buying pet insurance, they’re not going to pay you a penny. You submit your claim and it’s like, “from your doctor visit on 12/25/19, we need to see the Dr.’s notes” they just make up dates to delay. No, there was no exam on 12/25/19 that was Christmas Day and the office does not open on Christmas Day. And you ask a question about something and you can’t talk to a human being, it’s all cold hard texts. Waste of money.
title: Honestly the WORST experience with Fetch

text:
I purchased my Fetch plan a few years ago.  Recently my 5 yr. old Golden Retriever started acting funny.  She stopped eating and drinking.  After a few days, she curled up in ball and just laid there not moving.  We had to carry her to the car to get her to the vet.

We took her to our regular vet.  No help.  We took her to an emergency animal hospital.  No help.  Finally, we took her to a specialist about an hour from our house.

At this point I had accrued about $1,000 in vet bills.  But the big shock was about to come.  The vet specialist showed me an estimate of just over $6,000 for her treatment.  Having Fetch I knew that I had coverage for her.  But I will be honest, I never tried to use it before.  So I was a little nervous.  Would they actually pay?  I was about to find out.  I authorized the treatment and hoped for the best.  My dog turned out fine.  She is as good as new.  

Following her treatment, I submitted all of my bills to Fetch.  It was soooo easy.  Done right on line.  I was responsible for a $300 deductible and a 20% co-payment.  In less than two weeks I receive a check for about $5,300. 

And even better yet.  The amount was directly deposited into my checking account and I was able to quickly pay off the money I had to borrow for my dog's treatment.

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND FETCH.  I HOPE YOU NEVER NEED IT.  BUT IF YOU DO, YOU WILL BE GLAD YOU HAVE IT!!!
title: Absolutely True Story

text: I have had my Boxer in for numerous appointments over the past month trying to figure out why she's not feeling well which is costly so I called Fetch just to verify that things would be covered and I was assured they would be but I wasn't confident until I got my first reimbursement then every claim afterwards was reimbursed without hesitation and fast, this is the first time I've needed to use my insurance since taking it out 6 years ago but they certainly stepped up to the plate for me. Thanks Fetch 💕

text: This insurance company is bogus. My cat got sick about a month after my coverage started. I had to pay for everything out of pocket and then it took nearly TWO MONTHS to get a response back on the claim. They denied the claim because there wasn’t enough “proof” that my cat was not sick before this visit, even though I had him at the vet 5 months prior to the policy start date and he had a full work up done less than 1 year prior to the start date and was in perfect health. Unreal. They say they cover everything but you need to jump through too many hoops to qualify for the coverage. Even the vet clinic said they couldn’t believe what Fetch was asking me for. And every time I’ve spoken to customer service they have been unhelpful, cold, and downright rude. These people DO NOT care about you or your animal. Please, if you love your pet, trust me and DO NOT go with this insurance company.

text: I was a loyal customer for 7 years, but ever since The Dodo took over it has been nothing but grief. They never communicate with you, they will lower your cover and raise your premiums at any time with no warning, and you will only find out when the 100% increased premium overdrafts your account. No emails, no notifications on the app, NOTHING. Two stars ONLY because they refunded my money when I cancelled. Avoid at all costs. Their shady practices are not worth it in the long run.

text: I have had fetch insurance for a few years and have never had to use it.In July 2022 I had to take my dog to the vet because he didn’t seem right.He was diagnosed with anaplasmosis and I submitted an er bill and two follow up bills.They asked for medical history so I submitted that also.Then they asked for flea and tick prevention receipts.He has a seresto collar on from March to November then I use wondercide from November til March.I did not have receipts for purchase.I buy when they are on sale and never thought to save receipts for it so I sent in pictures of what I have.They told me they didn’t think it would be accepted because I don’t have receipts and I could have just had the stuff laying around??Who would go out and buy flea and tick prevention and just leave it laying around the house for no apparent reason? Seems they are trying to find anyway possible  to get out of paying a claim.His policy has doubled within the past two years with no claims submitted for anything.What these claims amount to is not even what I pay out in a year for him.Do better Fetch.No one would just have flea and tick treatments laying around for no apparent reason.I hope u see this is fix this problem and pay like you should be.to add to reply:I am not as worried at premium as I am about u not paying this claim or that the supervisor changed the claim in the system and resubmitted it.He also couldn’t answer where in the policy it states that u do not pay for tick related diseases.It states you do not pay or reimburse for tick and flea protection-big difference.I told him you may want to rewrite entire policy on this because there is nothing that states that or that states you need flea and tick prevention receipts for the entire year before.I submitted receipts that the pet store manager took alot of time to find and am waiting to hear back.So ridiculous.Please rewrite your policy correctly and pay what u should pay.
title: I have had fetch insurance for a few…

text: We recently adopted a rescue dog and when he arrived to DC he developed allergies. We took him in for his first vet visit and they identified an unknown allergy. We tried the initial vet suggestion of fish oil (for the skin) and Zyrtec, but neither of those worked. We then got Fetch pet insurance, and after the 15-day waiting period expired, we went back to the vet to get him reevaluated. They ran tests and gave him an allergy shot and some pills and a spray (which totaled in the hundreds of dollars). However, since the first vet visit listed an unknown allergy, they considered the whole experience a pre-existing condition. I called to get some clarity on this policy, and they informed me that all future allergy treatments would thus be considered "pre-existing" since it was on his first vet record, and wouldn't be covered. I will be looking elsewhere for pet insurance, as the entire process has been cumbersome and frustrating, and Fetch is just taking in premiums and not paying out claims. I'm wondering why I have pet insurance if these claims aren't covered.
title: Next to zero coverage for claims

text:
Considering pet insurance? Do NOT sign with 
FetchByTheDodo. After adopting a cat from 
Oregon Humane Society in June, we were incentivized to set up Fetch plans for all of our cats, who were then insured by a pricier company. So we did. Weeks later, our entire household was infected by a parasite that the poor cat brought home. Thankfully he's better now, but our other cats aren't. 
Fetch has denied every claim related to this parasite by labeling the infections as "pre existing." We're lucky to have never needed to use our past pet insurance. The last time any of our cats needed a vet visit was 2018. No conditions or illnesses, as documented by our previous insurer. Fetch is able to justify denial because we don't have recent vet records. We did not know that any illness we unwittingly brought home with our new cat would not be covered. We should not have been advised to switch over without also having been communicated the risks. And because we switched, our previous insurer has told us they may not "take us back." There isn't much we can do at this point aside from being vocal about our experience with Fetch and to encourage others not to sign on. This is not a superior pet insurance provider. Don't let The Dodo's animal-obsessed image or their reasonable prices fool you.
title: Do not switch to Fetch if you're already insured.

text:
If you consider a dog having tartar at every vet visit a pre existing condition you’re nothing but a scam and your explanation means nothing other than your excuse not to pay out a claim.
If you find me any dog who hasn’t had tartar from the minute they are born would be a miracle as even humans go to a dentist 2-3 times a year to clean their teeth and we brush and floss.  Either way increasing premiums and denying claims based on the inevitable is essential a crime in my books.  You’ve taken approximately $15-20k of my money for both my pets with basically hardly any claims and when the time matters you have loopholes to make the position of owing a pet difficult while you profit.   I will not test with this answer and raise the issues with pet insurance to ensure pet owners aren’t continuously scammed
title: Worst company I have ever dealt with…

text:
I have been a client for at least 7 years with Petplan, and the service used to be superb until a few years ago when they got rid of the team who would help get missing paperwork for the claims. 
The latest issue was that MY PREMIUM HAS TRIPLICATED from one moment to another without notice!
Now,  If I want my premium to get somewhat closer to what it used to be, they are forcing me to lower the coverage, duplicate the deductible, etc. 
When I first became a member it was with the promise that the younger the dog was, the insurance would stay lower. 
At this point is as if I was a completely new client with an older- much higher-risk dog. Never mind that my dog has been healthy and the claims for the occasional mild accident or an episode of tummy infection, thus very low claims. 
I am feeling very sad and upset about the injustice. If I knew this would happen, I would have rather paid every visit to the vet out of pocket since we have paid more in insurance premiums than in medical costs. 
Don't believe for a second that your furry baby will be protected in old age!
Still, I have not heard from them, and they are not willing to help on the phone. Beyond frustrating!

text:
I have submitted smaller claims before, under $350, with no problems. The process was easy and I was reimbursed in a good time-frame. It wasn't until I submitted for something larger that they broke out previously unknown policy terms to deny my claim. I was misled and told that I can submit claims for anything within the policy year and this was a very nasty surprise. At the end of the day, it is my fault for trusting the customer assistance and information I was given when I first contacted them when I was still shopping around for the best options for my new puppy. I'm really not surprised that an insurance company lied to get business. I probably still have the spreadsheet I made comparing 6+ pet insurance companies that include notes from actually contacting them for policy details. 

Save your money and go elsewhere. We got pet insurance in the first place to cover higher bills but they seem unwilling to actually reimburse. 

My dog now has something that might qualify as a pre-existing condition so we wouldn't be able to even switch providers. Don't let yourself get trapped with this company like we did. 

I also found it extremely distasteful that while they provide you text and email updates on your claim progress, including notifications if it's approved, you don't get any notification of your claim being denied. I strongly suspect that it's because they hope you forget about it until you fall outside of the claim period (which is 90 days, and confusingly not the policy year). The customer service is unhelpful and unwilling. If your claim gets denied, be prepared to receive no good-faith assistance.  

It doesn't matter how nice the app is and don't be fooled by how professional they look. Please, please, please, don't get Fetch by The Dodo.

Edit 01/8/2022
Fetch has confirmed the validity of my review and I, once again, encourage pet parents to go elsewhere for their insurance. My claim was under $700 which is a drop in the bucket compared to how expensive it can be when things go really wrong. I'll be contacting the provided help email and I'll be happy to revise my review if my *only* large claim gets approved in the spirit of staying true to what one of their customer service agents told me to get me to get me to sign up with their company in the first place.
title: Bad for big claims, good for small.

text:
They have no Deaf/HOH-friendly customer service. Their chat "customer service" is unable to help with anything. So, I was unable to find a person to chat with to cancel my account. After telling the chat person multiple times that I couldn't call the number they wanted me to call, I was finally given an email. I requested that my policies be cancelled. The next day, they charged for all of my policies instead of cancelling. Then, they emailed me and only cancelled one policy seven days after my request. I emailed back requesting again that the other two also be cancelled and that I be given an update on when Fetch would refund their charges since they made them after I requested the policies be cancelled. My other two policies still have not been cancelled and my refund has not been processed.

ETA: Since posting the review, Fetch got ahold of me via email and cancelled all three policies. They gave me a partial refund for each, not a full refund like they should have. All told, it took them 13 days to cancel the policies and begin a refund process after I requested the cancellation. Overall, I don't recommend this company to any pet owner, but I definitely do not recommend to anyone in the disabled community.
title: Not a disability friendly company

text:
This review is for ADAM ALTMAN specifically, not for Fetch's over all service which has been disappointing concerning my newest policy *handling. 
[*A claim submitted for services in May/22 had been linked/matched IN ERROR by your system with my OLD policy which I had hastily cancelled in Feb/22.
After that happened, I called Customer Service and an agent successfully transferred the claim to my NEW correct policy.
However, over this last long weekend, I saw a notification that my policy, which had an active claim under review, was cancelled!
I did not receive any email about this, however....and my Active Claim information which had previously appeared and which I had been following, had completely disappeared.]
I phoned Customer Service and ADAM ALTMAN responded with excellent assistance in correcting this error on Fetch's part and stayed on the line with me to ensure everything appeared to be successfully rectified.
He even called me back twice, immediately, at the start of our call(s) when 2 separate calls dropped off!

Many thanks to you, Adam!
I know you will keep up such good service for all who contact you for assistance!
title: This review is for ADAM ALTMAN…

text: We took our Chihuahua (Poco) in for a routine teeth cleaning.  During the initial testing, the doctor found some blood in his urine.  The doctor investigated and found he had numerous stone like deposits in his bladder.  They operated on him and removed all the he is his old self again.  We have had our insurance through Fetch (formerly PetPlan) for approximately five years.  I filed our first claim and Fetch settled it within the week.  Outstanding service!  I have recommended Fetch to all our friends and neighbors.
title: Chihuahua with bladder stones

text:
I've had Fetch Pet Insurance since we got our dog at 3 months. She has been enrolled and has not presented any problems since we got her other than a stomach issue. All documents have been submitted to Fetch on time since we got out policy. 

Last month she started biting her paws and the vet has advised us that she could be presenting allergies. Fetch has started requesting a significant amount of documents (which they already have) and keep delaying the review of our claim. Unfortunately, it looks like they are looking for the needle in the haystack to avoid covering this problem. It's very unfortunate to deal with companies that are fully focused on making sure you pay your premiums on time but that delay paying out your claims and do provide a clear explanation of why they would need a significant amount of non-related documentation and tests (even from our vet's point of view - "they are requesting non-related / non-sense information from your pet. Think about switching to other insurance"). 

I would be switching from Fetch to other providers that are more transparent in the claim process.

UPDATE: after requiring additional documentation that wasnt linked to the claim, they have partially approved the claim. However, as mentioned before - interesting enough they have requested medical records for the last 2 years for a dog that has always been insured with them and that has never presented issues. While discussing with the vet, the example I was given by the vet is “well, it’s like requesting a person’s medical records for the past years just to see if the person is actually allergic to something. Shouldn’t be the case. Instead, they should run tests on the person to ensure s/he isnt allergic.”
title: Typical Insurance provider - stay away or you wont get paid!

text: My cat Chili suddenly became ill mid Feb..I took him to emergency vet clinic and he stayed there for 3 days..I had to cancel my Cancun trip since we didn't get a conclusive reason for the sickness except WBC was through the roof.. they paid every bill and it is still ongoing, thank-you I am so grateful to not have to decide if I could treat him or not 🙏❤️

I purchased insurance in November for my 10yr old Maltipoo. Once my first payment was made, they started with typical insurance BS. I called customer service for information and I was met with a young snotty girl who gave me every reason why my claim would NOT be paid. AWFUL! Now I know you can’t judge a company by one person, however my experience did not get better. I would submit paperwork and was told I did not or they couldn’t make it out. It was just all terrible. 

Bottom line, out of $2400 FETCH paid $359. I was drawn in by their commercial and should have read reviews. I hope mine helps someone.

text: I rolled into Fetch since it acquired Pet Plan. My first bill since the acquisition was pretty high and the first customer rep I spoke to was admittedly a 1 star. I was convinced this was the service I should now expect but I called again and I am so glad I did! In my second call I spoke with Adam Altman and he was absolutely amazing! I admittedly went into the conversation in a mood from my last call but his incredibly calm and professional demeanor took less than 30 seconds to help turn my mood and impression around. Not only was he a pleasure to speak to, professional, and an excellent listener (understanding of my concerns), he was also proactive. I was certain I needed to find another company however, after speaking with Adam and his supervisor (His service was definitely deserving of a good review) I was convinced that this was the correct company for me and my adorable boy, Oscar. Adam and his supervisor embodied great customer service and when you are stressed about your pet and ensuring that they receive the best possible care, it's important. Thanks for making me feel more comfortable Adam I wish you nothing but the best!

FETCH FOR MY SHIH TZU

MY DOG UNFORTUNATELY WAS DIAGNOSED WITH CUSHING'S DISEASE AND THANK GOD I HAD FETCH INSURANCE FOR HER BECAUSE THE DIAGNOSIS ALONE COST ALOT OF MONEY AND FETCH REIMBURSED ME MY PERCENTAGE FOR THE TESTING AND CONTINUED TREATMENT.  SO HAPPY I PURCHASED THIS INSURANCE.

text:
My 4month old boxer JoJo collapsed after running and playing in the backyard. After taking JoJo to the cardiologist, eeg and ultrasound confirmed a heart defect called “Subaortic Stenosis”, JoJo has to take beta blockers for the rest of his life. We submitted our first claim for almost $700 and in less than 5 weeks we were approved and reimbursed.Easy as could be!
JoJo had to see the cardiologist 6 months later for a check up. The bill was just under $400. We submitted the claim to Fetch,this time we were reimbursed in less than 1.5 weeks. Easy as could be!
It’s worrisome raising a puppy knowing he has a heart condition and the cost of keeping JoJo healthy means a lifetime of medication and annual visits to cardiologist. 
Thank goodness for Fetch! 
So far.. they’ve always had our back!
Sincerely, Jojos parents
title: My 4month old boxer JoJo collapsed…

text: The most challenging aspect is trying to actually reach a human or ask AI something other than the questions they have for you to choose from. Very frustrating. Our dog is a re-home and we do not have medical records for his entire life. Medical records submitted prior to purchase of insurance or claim. Asking for medical records from a re-home and during the pandemic, medical records for 2020 when the 1st time we could go was 2021.  Dog has received a perfect bill of health prior to purchasing insurance but FETCH wants records that I do not have.  Communication is really tough.  Pretty sure I would not purchase this insurance again and suggest others do the same. Trupanion looks like the smartest choice as the vet can submit the invoice for you

text: July 25,2022 update: I cannot believe they just called me to offer to reinstate one of my three policies! They wanted to offer me a discounted rate to reactivate one of my three policies, do they not look at your file, do they not read that I asked to be on the do not call list. No shame, to put me through months of work, then when I cancel they want my money again. Your response is just more lips service with no actual customer service. I did send the documents to you, I am the policy holder. Even yesterday when I cancelled my 3 policies the representative I spoke with told me a supervisor would call me yesterday, but as I expected no call. Do not recommend, you can only communicate via email, have 3 dogs insured for over a year, never a claim. My first claim was denied, they state it was preexisting. They would not speak with me or my vet, I could not speak with anyone. I sent 5 emails, follow up paperwork from 2 previous vets, that I sent as my dogs are rescues and have been vetted every step before I adopted. text:
I decided to enquired about pet insurace because its time, I have a 6 year old healthy shih tzu but many friends of mine have pet insurace and encourage me to get some!! .  
However finding the right insurace was hard.  they are many out there the online quotes are not for me!! because you can't ask questions about the" in between the lines types of policys". 
So I called I spent the better part of the afternoon talking to  various pet company's . 
I found that many did not take their time to explain the policy  or  the word " coverage" properly or just wanted to get off the phone as quickly as possible.  
When I got to Fetch its was 6: 30 pm I figure It will be the same but to my surprise I got a lovely woman her name is  Ilona Gaspar, words can't describe how wonderfull and knowledgeable she is. She is not a sale person she is genuinely someone who wants to help you find and  understand what is "pet insurace ", she being a Pet parent herself of an rescue and now older dog . Ilona explain what is coverage, what is covered ,not covered and why!! . 
I was impress that she took the time to educated me and help me choose a plan suiteable for me.  I choose what was suitable for me and my pets needs now ,as well as in the future. 
Also the options I had to downgrade if I need to or upgrade my plans if my situation ever need to change  with our penalty . I am very very happy with Fetch and their super Amazing staff . I am thankfull  specially to Ilona for her time and patience . I recommend them for sure .
title: Great coverage & What amazing custumer service

text: I was discouraged by some pet insurance agents before I signed with Fetch. I was able to received from Fetch my 2 claims up to this date. They work fast. Honestly, this is the agency that gives a very efficient guidelines. Before I got my dog a pet insurance we've paid thousands of dollars already. All emergency vet visits :( Now, we are very comfortable going for pet visits. Every insurance has the deductable fee. You should ask everything what you want to know before signing. Health insurance will rob your wallet. Be mindful. This is the time of recession but our government is really in denial of that. It's a hard time these days, financially. Having a dog is a stress reliever, I love them so much. They gave me so much happiness and they love me unconditionally. I will not let vet fee take that bond away from us and not takecare of my dogs health. Be smart. I've called so many pet insurance company. This agency by far accomodates my capacity to pay. Thank you Fetch for understanding my financial capacity.

text:
Update: Fetch reached out to me and we got things resolved. I still think the huge increase is crazy but at least we got the new pricing figured out.  I'm still a customer.

I have had insurance through Fetch for 6 or 7 years. I got it for my puppy back when it was Petplan. They have always been good and easy to work with. Customer service was always helpful. The price goes up each year which I expect. However, this year when it renewed, the price rose by 41%!! I called to ask why and they said it was based on my dog's age and breed. We haven't had any major issues and just one small claim. The rep suggested that I downgrade the coverage to save money. He emailed me several quotes. I chose one and thought that was the end of it. When I went online to verify they payment, it was 15% more than what he quoted me. I called back in and they essentially told me that he made a mistake and that they wouldn't honor the quote. I don't appreciate the way they handled things and now it's not worth the money. So, after all these years, I cancelled and will look for another company. I don't know what has changed with them. It's unfortunate though.
title: Good until it wasn't

text: We've been with Fetch (formerly Petplan) for four years now and have been very pleased with our choice to insure with this company. Our dog, Cassius, has had injury/surgery/rehab (ruptured ACL) and an ongoing medical condition and in each case, Fetch has fulfilled its obligation with excellent customer service and timely payment.
title: Excellent pet insurance!

text: My dog had to go to the emergency vet due to several days of GI issues (all over the house). During a scary and stressful time it is comforting to know that no matter what happens I know the bill will be at least partially covered by pet insurance.  I filed the claim and received payment within a few days via direct deposit.  (Dog is recovered too :D.) I only wish I had selected a lower deductible and higher percentage of coverage when I first enrolled because once you file any claims you cannot change it.  But, when they are puppies you don’t think you’ll ever need to use the insurance.  As she gets older I have had to use it several times and am so glad to have it! Recommend to everyone getting a new pet.

Within two days my credit card was credited.  I was flabbergasted!  I will definitely get Fetch insurance for our next pet.
title: Excellent customer service and very quick claim payment! payout

text: Continued good service.  I have been a customer for years.  Our husky has received great care.  It’s calming to know we have this coverage.  Even though as our dog ages and it gets expensive we know we are more likely to need the coverage more than ever.  One tip?  A big procedure recommendation from your vet? Get a estimate and send it to fetch.  They have always preapproved it for us and there is never a hassle after we do the work (like a bad tooth/abscess removal for 2 grand).  Don’t wish you had Insurance after something happens, get it now.
title: Continued good service

text: Over the past few months our aging dogs have had a number of issues that ended up costing several thousands of dollars in specialist fees and procedures. Thankfully we had our insurance policies from the get-go. Fetch was super easy to use and we were compensated quite quickly. So happy we did this long ago. The policies have paid for themselves. I am a small animal veterinarian and a big advocate for pet insurance for this very reason.
title: Worth every penny

text: Well, apparently we experienced some sort of glitch with my new policy. Payment went through but, the new policy was nowhere to be found. Somehow it didn’t link to my existing account. Fortunately my phone call about the issue led me to Regina who promptly found a remedy to the problem, refunded my original payment and even got me a discount on my new policy! I cannot say enough about Regina’s professionalism in not only dealing with my issue but, also finding an easy and painless solution! Thank you again Regina!
title: Problem Solved

text: So, I’ve been with this company, for close to 15+ years, when it was called Petplan and before being bought out numerous times by other companies. They used to be the best in terms of coverage and overall value and ease of claims. They are now anything but that. One of the worst things is their per incident deductible. As an example, I’ll use a $200 deductible. So, if you bring your pet to the vet for anything, let’s say 5 times in a year. Well, if each of the 5 times that you brought your pet in was for a different reason your total deductible will be a whopping $1,000. That’s absolutely ridiculous. They also, not only, raised my rates this coming year but they reduced the coverage on one of my pets. They actually told me that the reason they reduced coverage was that they weren’t making enough money off me which I found totally absurd. And the rate hike isn’t even reasonable. I was paying around $1,500 yearly for my two pets last year. This year they want over $4,000 per year. Hell no. I will be dropping them lime a hot potato. Stay far away from this company. There are much better plans available elsewhere.
title: Worst pet insurance company ever

text: Honestly, I’m less than impressed with Petplan ever since they became Fetch. I was double charged this week, and they told me they charged me for this month and the next by accident. If I hadn’t noticed, I’m sure they would still be charging me next month. That’s freaky and very unprofessional. Also, for the third week in a row, I received an email stating my payment did not go through and I’d need to update my payment information. The email makes it seem as though it’s my fault, and states that my plan will be cancelled if my payment doesn’t work. It’s the same card I’ve used for the whole plan and it’s definitely not my fault, it’s their system’s fault. I would love to switch to another insurance company but we all know how well that works out!
title: Not impressed

text: I spoke to a women today (lindsey) about a claim and she could not have been nicer and gave me all the answers. I must say that I have never had a problem with fetch and I think they should start a new company teaching customer service!!!!
title: customer service

text: I submitted a claim and had accidentally switched something on my form, I was able to talk to someone on the phone, she was very nice and incredibly helpful. I’m very glad I chose Fetch for my pets insurance.
title: Very helpful customer service

text: I had to call for a billing issue and was lucky to get through to Lindsay. She was AMAZING and lovely to talk to (:
title: I had to call for a billing issue and…

text: I always had a good experience with Fetch and the people I talk to you on the phone are very helpful
title: I always had a good experience with…

text:
This review is in two parts: Fetch and Petplan.

With Fetch, talking to Regina B. was a great help and she was very polite. As to service I do wish they would also cover routine vaccines and payouts seem to be faster.

Under Petplan, when my Blue Healer had an accident jumping a small wall. When I filed a claim they would not cover it citing his knee injuries were pre-existing injuries even though he had no problems before the accident. Even after the vet told them they were wrong, Petplan still refused to pay. I do hope Fetch will correct this issue and cover future treatments.
title: This review is in two parts

text:
Trust the one star reviews, seriously. We have had claims denied due to “pre existing” conditions that they cannot even give an explanation for. 

It’s sad how much control they have. They are not here to help our pets, they’re here to make money. Disgusting.
title: Trust the one star reviews

text:
UPDATE: It is June 1st and still no contact or resolution.

UPDATE: It has been 3 days and they have not bothered contacting me after "looking into" my claim. Just more lies. Same old terrible customer service.

THIS COMPANY IS A JOKE! SEEK INSURANCE ELSEWHERE!!!!
During Covid I rescued 2 kittens. Before I signed up I specifically asked if the health certificate, rabies certificate, felv/fiv negative results and spay certificate was enough for coverage since getting into a vet was out of the question. Fast forward to 1.5 years of taking my money for 2 policies and I finally have a claim. They are saying the paperwork I was given upon adoption isn’t good enough to be their “first exam” and declined my claim. Even though I specifically asked if it would count towards coverage when trying to decide which company to choose. 
I was lied to on the phone and bought policies under false pretenses! I didn’t have access to the app for nearly a year and nobody could explain why. Now I have an $1100 claim and they are denying it. Shameful customer service. It’s like talking to a robot who can only repeat the same few sentences! Spare yourself the time and money and choose another company!! Pet plan used to be great- it’s not anymore!
title: THIS COMPANY IS A JOKE

text:
Lindsey Farley was great. I asked her a few questions and she went immediately and looked up the information to relay back to me. 

She was professional and very knowledgeable!
title: Lindsey Farley was great

text: This "insurance" has been the worst I have ever experienced in my life. They double charged me for my one dog for 3 months, upon calling to get it corrected, it was near impossible to reach someone. Fast forward a year later, I am trying to cancel my services because they increased my monthly fee by $30 without any indication or explanation as to why. They have told me they will refund me the month of services that were charged that I never used, but instead of receiving said refund they have charged me for another month of service!!! The company legitamtly comes across as a scam, and has cost me far more money then has ever been returned. I now need to cancel my credit card in order to stop payments from continuing to come out. Because even on the app, it says my policy is canceled. Yet I can't remove my credit card and they keep charging. Absolutely terrible company. I would highly highly advice against even looking into this company.
title: Avoid this company at all costs

text: Fetch has always gone above and beyond in both customer service and policy coverage. We have used them since we first got a dog in 2016, and I am so excited to use them for every pet ever owned. Cannot recommend enough!
title: Fetch has always gone above and beyond…

text: We are so very pleased we are with our policy with Fetch. When Vito started showing signs of allergy issues we wanted to do everything we could to try and work on them without going right to Apoquel or Cytopoint. Our vet has been amazing in helping us along this path with the allergy testing, allergy drops, Golden Link and the recommendation of CBD. And Fetch has been amazing in helping us cover these costs with our policy. The claim submitting process is so easy and their communication is outstanding. I tell everyone I can about Fetch and encourage them to get a policy for their dog. Thank you for being a wonderful company. Thank you for making things easier for us.
title: We LOVE Fetch!!!

text: I am giving this pet insurance company a 1 star rating. I recently received an annual premium increase of 40% with no claims made!  Having my other dogs insured with another insurance company, I have never, ever seen rate hikes of this amount. I will never buy from Fetch again, nor would I recommend to dog friends either.
title: Huge Premium Increase

text: Fetch has been a life saver! We have a wonderful little dachsund - she was a rescue puppy so we weren't aware of her family history. I got insurance for her because I learned that wieners have a proclivity for back disease. At almost 3 yrs old, she suffered an episode and starting walking funny. We rushed her to the ER immediately. She received phenomenal care and never became paralyzed, and thank goodness for Fetch! Having a pup with back disease is beyond stressful and knowing I had pet insurance allowed me to focus on taking care of our girl. Fetch was quick and easy and reimbursed me! THANK YOU FETCH!
title: Fetch has been a life saver

text: Great customer service.  Reps are knowledgeable, pleasant and go above and beyond to answer your questions.  Great job on hiring and training!!
title: Great customer service

text: They cover all my pet’s expenses during the two nights at the vet. Everything that I expected the insurance to cover was paid for. You just need to submit the documents needed to process the reimbursement.
title: Pet Hospital Expenses

text:
I hate doing this. I have had nothing but great experiences through petplan.. until now. Unfortunately, this experience is bad enough to warrant no more than 1 star. My dog needed behavioral therapy training due to some changing behavior. Our vet referred us to a behaviorist who did a wonderful job. Our plan includes behavioral coverage and specifically states "behavior therapy." When our claim was denied, I called to inquire. I was informed that "in the terms and conditions" it says that any behavioral training MUST be done by a licensed vet. In our area, there are behavioral training centers, and vets do not do any type of behavioral training, hence the referral (not sure if it's like this everywhere?). I informed them that I had a referral from the vet and that our vet does not do any behavioral training. I also informed them that it was a licensed "behavioral therapist" that performed the training. I was told there was nothing I could do or send in to get it covered due to the wording in the terms and conditions. 
Advertising in policy documents and coverage details that behavioral therapies are covered, but only covering them if performed by a certified vet (which is not listed in the policy documents with behavior coverage, and is ONLY in the terms and conditions) strikes me as a company that is trying to trick people into paying for services that should be covered under their plan. Shady back room jargon is not for me. I will be switching coverage. Best of luck everyone.
title: Hope your Vet does it all!

text:
I would not recommend them. We had 3 of our dogs insured by them. One of our dogs was on their policy from 2 1/2 years old. The premiums were reasonable until he was 8 years old. He had a bout of Mast Cell cancer which was treated and we got reimbursed without complications. Upon renewal, the premiums suddenly jumped from $1,500 per year to $3,500 per year. A year later, we just got the renewal letter and they now want $4,500 a year - that is $375 a month! It is a complete rip-off and basically tells you that they are cheap and make profits when the dogs are young and no claims are made, but the moment the dogs get old they jack up the prices when you really need them. So, you are left with three choices: 
1 - Cancel the insurance and pay out of pocket (of course all the money you already gave the insurance over the years is lost) 
2 - Continue to pay the insurance for your peace of mind, especially now that our dog has pre-existing conditions
3 - Find another carrier, and carefully research their pre-existing condition clause. It was very stressful and took lot of time to research. 
We opted for #3. Shame on you, Fetch by The Dodo, previously known as Pet Plan. I have sent in my cancellation notice today for all 3 dogs we had under your care.
title: Do not buy - they will rip you off

text:
Words cannot express how grateful
I am to have Fetch pet insurance. At this moment, my beloved dog Lily is being treated for cancer, and knowing that we can count on Fetch to help lessen the financial burden and ensure she can receive the treatment she needs means the world to me.

The Fetch app is also great and easy to use. I just upload the invoice and medical records after each visit, and the claims approval process has been very quick, usually approved within a few days and now even better direct deposit is available. Lily has been going to chemo every week now for five weeks, and each week I just go to the app and upload the documents as a continuing claim.

I’ve been with Fetch (formerly PetPlan) since I adopted Lily over 11 years ago, and before that with Sophie when the company was PetPlan. I’ve seen the claims experience evolve from paper forms to now an app, and the process has become streamlined. The only thing I miss is being able to talk to a claims person more easily, as all communication now seems to be done via chat and email. I recently submitted an estimate for pre-authorization (meaning I wanted to know what coverage would be), and even though it was marked as such in the email it became a claim in the app that kept requesting an invoice; I never got an answer on the coverage but the good news is Lily did get the procedure done and it was covered as expected.

Sophie had insurance with a different company before PetPlan/Fetch, and the experience was terrible; they denied claims even when her vet wrote letters in support of
coverage, and luckily I found PetPlan and was able to switch. PetPlan/Fetch was able to provide coverage when she got cancer, and ensured that finances would not prevent me from getting her treatment.

I originally got pet insurance after meeting a woman at the dog park one day. The woman was looking through the fence and crying. I asked her if she was okay, and she tearfully explained that she had just had to put her dog to sleep because the dog needed treatment she could not afford. She said Sophie reminded her of her dog. I got pet insurance that day, hoping to avoid the heartbreak of not just losing your beloved dog but having to make a decision based on finances.
title: Best Pet Insurance I’ve Ever Had

text: Janelle Sorenson helped with my endless questions and comparisons. She’s very knowledgeable and I’m very happy to be a part of Fetch by dodo for my pet Sancho. It’s taken 18 years to get another pet after my Bobo passed away and he was covered the by Pet Plan which is now a part of Fetch by the Dodo. Thank you very much for all your help Janelle.
title: Janelle Sorenson helped with my endless…

text: Best pet insurance we have had so far. Great customer service, rates and easy to manage.
title: Best pet insurance we have had so far

text: Fetch is truthful on their claims processing and time allotted. Have had several claims with our dog and were processed quickly. Claims process is very easy
title: Fetch is truthful on their claims…

text: We have had Petplan insurance since our cat was a tiny kitten.  A couple of years ago he developed an auto-immune condition that needs expensive medication ($200 every couple of months).  He also needed tooth extractions related to the disease ($1,100).  Petplan has promptly paid the 90% called for once the annual deductible is satisfied, and it's been a huge relief to have help with these large bills.
title: Help with drug and dental costs

text: We have used Petplan (now Fetch) insurance for our dogs for the past 7 years. We now have 4 dogs insured under Fetch. Over the years, having pet insurance has allowed us to provide the best medical care for our dogs without having to worry about cost. We have a plan for each dog with 90% reimbursement. Fetch has a quick turn around time (usually about a week or less) to review our claims and issue reimbursement. We were able to get orthopedic surgery done on our newest rescue dog thanks to this insurance. We are also able to manage our oldest dog’s chronic autoimmune disorder thanks to this insurance. We are grateful to have it. Premiums seemed to increase substantially this year which is my reason for giving this 4 stars instead of 5 but in the long run, it’s still well worth it to keep my dogs healthy and happy.
title: Insurance for our 4 dogs

text: I have been with PetPlan (Fetch) since Loki, my now one year one month husky puppy was 10 weeks old. I made sure to get an insurance that covers both accidents and illness, and after paying the initial $300 per year, I have been able to claim 70% of every subsequent vet bill. This includes treatment and vet visit. The website and app are both easy to navigate and use. Claiming is easy. All you need is the invoice and the updated medical records. The money goes directly into my linked bank in the next three days after my claim goes through. They are really quick to process my claims and super helpful and responsive whenever I have a query. They also update me on all my claim processes. I have had a brilliant experience and would recommend this pet insurance company to all my dog owner friends!
title: Claiming is simple, quick and easy

text: There were lots of helpful directions in how to submit a claim and it was processed and paid out exactly as the directions explained it would be. It definitely gave me peace of mind to have coverage
title: Exactly as promised

text: I have had Fetch pet insurance since I got my dog and I highly recommend it to anyone bringing a dog into their family. The app is simple to use and direct deposit makes reimbursement of any pet expenses super quick!
title: Highly Recommend Fetch if You’re Looking for Pet Insurance

text: Janelle answered all my questions patiently when I was looking into getting pet insurance through Fetch.
title: Janelle answered all my questions…

text: I've been using Fetch (formerly GoPetPlan) for over 12 years with my senior pup and have never had a bad experience.
title: Great Service!

text:
When Fetch was Petplan- it was amazing, now Fetch has fallen short in my books.
My dog (accident prone) has had a handful of insurance claims (when Fetch was still Petplan)- with the last claim being in 2019. My monthly premium went up- totally fair. Today, over three years later I go to submit a claim and see my deductible is now $750 (was $200 with Petplan), with my claim being $600 and my deductible being so high it covers nothing. Fetch has also decided to only cover 70% where as Petplan covered 80%.
My dog was attacked and lost half his ear- a complete freak accident - THE REASON WE GET INSURANCE for our pets.

When calling and speaking to a representative I was told because of my claim activity they had to pay out over 3% above my premiums and deductibles (over three years ago)… is that not the intent of insurance? With my monthly premiums being $32 x12 months, x3 years, that’s roughly $1100 Fetch has in their pockets and will not be covering any part of my first claim in over three years. Just food for thought.

Yes, I should have carefully read the documents when Fetch took over Petplan- however we were assured that nothing would change and coverage would remain the same. Policy holders ensure you are fully reading your new/adjusted contracts with Fetch. 

Will be switching to a new company without a doubt. Sad to see Petplan go through so many changes yearly with new underwriters etc. I whole heartedly support pet insurance to help provide the best care for our animals, however very disappointed with Fetch.
title: Fetch falls short- BEWARE!

text: Was feeling very frustrated by a number of issues recently regarding my long-term policy but Fetch Mgr Regina Blair went above and beyond to address my problems. Thank you so much for your excellent customer service!

text:

Thanks Fetch!!

In addition to this, their customer service reps are all animal lovers, very knowledgeable and empathetic which is so nice and meant a lot to me when my dog was first diagnosed.

text: I bought insurance on both my pets when they first came home with me, 13 years ago. Although I didn't have to file claims on them other than twice during that time, here we are at end of life and both have significant disease. If it weren't for Fetch I would have had to send them to the Rainbow Bridge last year. text: Claims were very easy and simple. You are kept up to date via email and text for updates. I had no issue. Great service. I had them for all my pets. Very helpful when one of my dogs was going through his issues.
title: Claims were very easy and simple

text: (Canada) I echo others on the topic of this year's review. I contacted Fetch to discuss the 40% jump ($59-->$83) today in my premium. In 2021, $59. In 2020, $54. 6-year old dog. No health issues. I have been a customer for 3 years. Never missed a payment....never had a single claim. Not one. Yet, a 40% increase, hey, no problem. When I spoke to customer service all they said was 'yeah, that's the new plan cost now for your policy now'. I asked why the jump? They said, 'that's the cost now for your dog and policy'. I asked - am I getting more coverage? She said, 'no, that's the same coverage now.' It seems ever since the company was purchase, everyone is getting gauged.  I have already contacted Trupanion. They have provided a quote that is based on the cost of vet care and does not have a max payout (which is their business model). I asked that they call me back to revert this cost. I don't think they will, nor is it in their interest. It's really up to AXIS Reinsurance Company (the underwriter). A real shame. They really had a good and fair service (an increasingly tougher way to describe insurance companies, these days). My guess is the cost-benefit assessment done by their analysts which concluded that the company will lose policy holders (like me and others), but still see a much higher return when forcing existing customers to pay 30-40% year over year.
title: (Canada) 40% jump in premium cost

text: Regina B was super helpful getting my multiple policies squared away, and saved me a bunch of money on my premiums!

I am retired on fixed income that increase is way to much, just remember when you first get the insurance its not to bad but every year it will go up, my dog is ony 6 years old by the time he reaches 10 years old it could be over a 100.00 amonth

text: Jasmine is a Sato Project dog, rescued from Dead Dog Beach in Puerto Rico and arrived in a Freedom Flight early last year. Sadly, she came down with erlichia from a tick bite recently and her platelets were dangerously low - low enough for her to go into shock. We took her right into the ER and we were faced with possibly saying goodbye to her. Fortunately, we took out a Fetch policy as soon as we adopted her earlier last year, and we were able to save her. The policy is worth its weight in gold. Thank you, Fetch. Jasmine went through too much to get here and Fetch made it possible for her to live a best life yet to come. She is getting healthier, happier and lovelier.

text: The customer service has been great. Pleasant experience. The mobile app is user friendly. We appreciate improvements to the Canadian claim reimbursement process. text:
After 7 years of being a paying customer of Fetch,
this year my dog needed dog needed a Tibial Plateau Leveling Osteotomy (knee joint and patellar ligament).
This is the first major claim we have ever filed while paying premiums.  We filed our claim and all went well for reimbursement for the surgery.
I noticed my March billing was double from the previous year. I thought this was an error.
I called for clarification.  I was informed that was not a mistake that was my new rate for the new policy year, double the cost.
The customer service rep asked me if I would like to 
discuss less coverage for less money.
This company knowing my dog is older and has a 
predisposed condition( it sometimes happens on the 
other leg) they raise the customer rate doubled.
This is a predatory practice especially since they do real splashy ads for what they pay out for the clients. These are advertisements to lure you in to become a client. 
This is not client/animal advocacy. I would not recommend this company, hidden pricing practices.

text:
I am in the middle of re-processing my claims with Fetch, for 2 veterinary visits for our senior adopted cat.

After 2 vet visits we did not file claims for, that first vet wanted us to go elsewhere to explore why our cat was anemic. This anemia was NOT diagnosed until after our 2-week initial period with Fetch.

The ultrasound they did to look for an ulcer, found lympoma instead. This CANCER was also NOT previously diagnosed.

In the week or so where we were trying to figure out whether it would be better or worse to put our 16 year old cat through surgery to formally diagnose cancer...he stopped eating, and we brought him in for IV fluids and pain medicine, but he still wouldn't eat, and kept declining, so we had to make the awful decision to let him go.

Guess what Fetch did for us?

First, they demanded medical records dating back 2 YEARS, when they knew (via claim form submittals, phone calls, and email) that we only adopted him a few months prior.

Then, they have the gall to blame his needing ultrasounds AND 24/7 IV and pain meds, and then euthanasia...on IBD!  No.  We would NEVER put a cat to sleep because of the IBD we knew he had.  We put him to sleep because he wasn't eating or drinking and because his labs showed CANCER.

Of course, if they blame his IBD they get to call it "pre-existing condition".

AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL. We will be resubmitting with highlights showing where the vets suspected anemia and cancer.  But to be required to show 2 years of background records, and to be told we put our cat to sleep because of IBD (despite SOAP report describing LYMPHOMA) is appalling.

I can't submit new claim forms online because our policy is no longer active, as of the date we had to let our cat go.
I tried to add 4 images of the veterinary referrals that describe [previously undiagnosed] anemia, lymphoma, difficulty breathing, and inability to walk. It looks like I'm only allowed to show 1 photo, and cannot choose a different photo once I've uploaded one.
title: Fetch blames our cat's cancer & anemia...on IBD. NOPE!

text:
Definitely you will be surprise for each claim,and paying back process !
They always try to deduct something at the end,!
When you want to make contract you are eligible and welcome to all coverage, but after no,every day you’ll receive the email who said you’re not eligible for this this this,!

I was originally a pet plan policy holder back in 92’. A black cat named Warhol who was treated to the sum of $4,000 for urinary track infection! Since May 92’ found me in a major MVA , I was home when as a stray a group of us got him out from under the drive train of an all terrain vehicle! His company was a God send! Your saving his life, something I could never have afforded without you! Was paramount, as I was in a pretty bad state both physically and mentally! So thank you!
