title: Janelle made the process very easy and…

text:
My initial review was deleted so here it is again, as this is something I would have loved to see before purchasing this pet insurance, hope it helps someone.

Here is my original review 
"If your dog is going through anxiety, guarding issues, and being human aggressive, keep on looking for another insurance. Or make sure you read the fine print... When these guys say they cover "Behaviorist therapy" if that behavior therapy involves training your dog with a behaviorist to modify their behavior, don't hold your breath or expect Petplan Fetch to reimburse you. Apparently, training is not considered by them a part of behavior therapy for dogs"

Fetch tells you training is covered on their site, but when you file a claim, they tell you they ONLY cover it if the training happens in a place where there is a vet on staff. 

Have you ever gone to your vet and had them also train your dog? I doubt it. So if your vet diagnoses your dog and recommends medication and TRAINING as part of behavior therapy, that is still not good enough. You MUST train your dog in a place that has a vet on staff. I've been searching for a place like this, does not seem to exist. I asked Fetch to give me an example of a place with a vet and trainer on staff, and they could not come up with a single location.

Below is what's posted on the Fetch website where they advertise they cover training, but it is not true, as a vet recommendation is not enough. They will tell you they cover the vet-suggested treatment for behavioral issues, then tell you that they do not cover training for behavioral disorders in the same sentence. It's crazy! 

"Fetch pet insurance does cover behavioral training. So if your vet recommends that you see a trainer to help address your pet’s behavior, that will be covered. We’ll also cover any anxiety medication that your vet prescribes"

Worse of all, when you talk to them on the phone, they seem to really not care about the discrepancy with what they offer, vs what they deliver.

So if you are looking to get this insurance to help your pup with behavior issues, or just want to make sure you are covered in case your brand new puppy or rescue develops them, I recommend you explore all your options before you commit to Fetch.
title: LYING when they say they cover Behavior Therapy

text:

My concern is every year at renewal time I expect to have the same coverage and deductions etc.  No changes due to my 2 dogs aging.  This is why I purchased insurance at only 4.5 months of age for both my dogs.

text:
Now that they have changed from Pet Plan it is so bad, and the website doesn't work for you to track what they get and what they pay. For one dog alone they raised my one dog $1,700.00 US dollars. I pay over $4,000.00 before they even start paying for one pet alone. I have been with them for years as Pet Plan, but now I regret staying with them.
I just wrote all the details in a letter to the BBB. It entailed how I have been told different things by different employees and at the end of the day, it benefits their pocketbooks. 
I have submitted claims and they said they got them then they say they didn't, and you have no way to check when they do not show or give you access to all the documents on their end. It's bad very unethical behavior. 
You can also lookup how to file a complaint against an insurance company. They have government agencies that govern even Pet Insurance Companies
They need transparency and accountability.
Everyone notice the reply below. For the record I have reached out and nothing happened so now I will be changing my review to one star, not two.
Update:
I have done what they posted below. Here is today's correspondence:

Hi Colleen,
I am so sorry about the late response!
I do see that you spoke to Dan yesterday, but if there is anything you need, please let us know. We would be happy to help. I hope you have a wonderful week!
Best,
Kaitlyn

Dear Kaitlyn,
     I spoke with Dan yesterday 02/08/22, and we agreed to have a phone call today 02/09/22 from 1 pm to 2:30 pm California time. I raced home making sure at 1 pm that I was in front of my computer, and had paperwork in front of me with no distractions. It is now 2:40 pm California time on 02/09/22, and Dan has not called. Situations like today prove my point on the competency level of the service you offer. I would like a note put in Dan’s personal file on this issue. He is currently 1 hour and 40 minutes late in calling.
Regards,
Colleen Anderson

text:
When I got our first dog, I did tons of research. I am in a business where reading small prints is routine. So I did. PetPlan (now Fetch) was the best option for me as it allowed to customize your coverage and the deductible wasn’t per-case but annual. The last part of huge. Consider most visits are new cases, especially when dog is young, you will constantly be in new deductible field. 
Now, you have to make sure you do your part to have a smooth experience. I had my dog checked right after she joint the family and had letter from vet certifying that she was completely healthy. Then, make sure to have regular check ups and all vaccines. 
First time we had to deal with large bill, when she was bitten by a raccoon, I was concerned - will insurance make problems?  After I submitted the claim, I waited, and then phone rang. It was insurance. Great, I thought. What now? Well, they called to check on dog and to tell me that they have sent out the cheque! What ?!!!!
Now I have two dogs. Both are insured with Fetch. I am so happy with my choice 5 years ago that I talk about insurance to other dog owners and had two switching their insurance to Fetch. 
Thank you guys. You are going fine job !
title: Best decision getting dogs insured with Fetch

text: Gio, our beloved English Retriever came to us fully insured by his breeder, a Veterinarian from Champaign, IL over 10 years ago.  During Gio's first year of life---he experienced a shoulder injury while playing with a neighbor's dog---which lead us to his first joint surgery and insurance claim.  Playing at a puppy daycare led to ACL ruptures and back to back TPLO's (Back joint replacements ) when he was 4---2 large claims in the same year. All three surgeries were covered at 80% minus the deductible with no questions ask.  There were no claims filed for him from 2015 to September of 2021 when his vet discovered a mass (oral melanoma) in his upper palate. We chose  radiation therapy and a series of immunotherapy vaccines to shrink the mass and stabilize his quality of life.  He started limping during this time and was treated for an infection in a back digit/toe which didn't heal and the biopsy revealed a carcinoma resulting in the amputation of his toe which gave him back complete mobility. Gio began struggling with some labored breathing this past week and had made arrangements for him to be euthanized at home after a confirmation that the melanoma had metastasized in his lungs.  We took him out on Saturday morning to potty and he gently laid down in our backyard, closed his eyes and is now in Dog Heaven running free. I had received an email last week from Fetch asking for us to write a review, but went over our account so that I could be accurate with my review today.  Our current policy offered an annual limit of $15,000 with a $500 deductible and reimbursement at 70%.  We have filed 8 claims in 2021 totaling $14,587 and have been reimbursed $9,711 without a single issue.  I used the online website to file the claims and it was really simple. I want to thank Pet Plan and Fetch for doing business in an honest, professional and efficient manner.  We are very grateful and will not hesitate to insure our next puppy with you.
title: The Story of Gio----an English Cream Retriever ---dearly loved and covered for his Lifetime by Petplan/Fetch Insurance!

text: Fetch pet insurance has allowed us to make sure our pup is as healthy and happy as possible. His (sometimes extreme) enthusiasm for life makes him a bit accident prone and he also has two types of cancer, which means we spend a fair amount of time at vet hospitals worrying. Having Fetch takes the financial stress out of the equation so we can make medical decisions for our dog based solely on his veterinarians' advice and what is in his best interest. All of our claims have been handled without a hitch and Fetch reimburses us very quickly. Every day we get to spend with our dog is a gift and Fetch has given us so many more days to be grateful for.
title: Very Grateful for Fetch Pet Insurance

title: We purchased pet insurance from the…

text: My family is so very thankful that I purchased Fetch pet insurance for my 3 year old labradoodle Bentley when he was 8 weeks old back in June 2018. When Bentley was 2 years old I noticed he was licking the tip of his tail a lot. After inspecting his tail I noticed there was a small "pimple" on his tail that he would lick so much it would be raw and turn into a scab. After months of watching this I went to my vet who said we'd keep an eye on the size of it. After almost a year I noticed the "pimple" was getting larger and went back to the vet. She informed me that the "pimple" grew and I should now go to an Oncologist for a consultation. I spoke with the Oncologist who booked me an appointment and notified me of the cost. It was substantial but I knew that with Fetch on my side I would be covered 80% of the cost. Long story short, the "pimple" on Bentley's tail ended up being an extremely rare cancerous cyst which the doctor said was so rare there wasn't a lot of known cases she could refer to. The Oncologist recommended amputating Bentley's tail because they could not remove the cist and stitch the tail because there wasn't enough skin to close the open wound.  Three months after the amputation Bentley went in for a follow up  X-ray to check to see if the cancer had spread and to our disbelief it spread to 3 ping pong sized lymph nodes in his stomach and he went in for emergency surgery. Thankfully the surgery was a success and Bentley had 6 rounds of radiation and he has just finished his 4th chemo treatment with 2 more treatments to go. Last week he had X-rays to check his lungs to see if the cancer had spread and as of now we are thrilled to report it has not. Bentley was diagnosed in April 2021 with an Aprocrine Cyst Carcinoma on his tail and in September 2021 with Metastatic Neoplasm Adenocarcinoma.  The cost of Bentley's treatments was very expensive and Fetch reimbursed us so far over $21,000.  I can honestly say Bentley would not be with us today if we didn't have medical coverage. It was the best decision we ever made and I strongly encourage all pet owners to purchase health coverage in their pets the way they cover their family. Bentley is truly part of our family and we hope and continue to pray he remains healthy and a big part of our family for years to come. Thank you FETCH for helping to save Bentley's life.
title: Fetch Saved Bentley's Life

text: IIona Gaspar was absolutely amazing with all the information she provided me so I could make a comfortable decision about insurance for my pupster. I have researched lots of pet insurance companies and Fetch by The Dodo is by far the best. I am so happy I finally found insurance for my pupster that I am comfortable with!
title: IIona Gaspar was absolutely amazing…

text: I'm torn on how to rate Fetch. I've had my dog insured with Fetch for several years now under a fabulous plan that I freely chose -- 90% benefit coverage with unlimited annual benefits, with a $200 per illness/injury deductible. I chose this level of coverage because I never want to be faced with the situation of having to choose to withhold needed medical care for my pooch because I cannot afford it; however, Fetch's yearly premium increases are insane, with this year's being the most absurd ever. My policy renewed this year at a 42% premium increase!!!!! I just about had a heart attack when I received my renewal letter. I'm now paying $3500 this year to insure my 11-year-old dog who suffers from severe heart disease. So, while Fetch's coverage is excellent and their customer service has been great all these years, their premiums are outrageous. I told a Fetch rep a couple weeks ago through their Live Chat that insurance of all kinds on humans (auto, homeowners, health, life, LTC, etc.) doesn't even increase by 42% in a year. Then I get the usual spiel from the Fetch rep......well, you can lower your premium by lowering your benefits. Yeah, I get that -- you get what you pay for. But really, if you choose Fetch, be prepared to pay. Their website, customer service and the time it takes to reimburse on claims are all great, but you pay for that. And, despite what they recently emailed to all policyholders ensuring us that Fetch did not increase premiums to cover their recent rebranding efforts, I do not believe it. The entire rebranding of any company is very costly and they have to get money to pay for that from somewhere. Premiums are an insurance company's biggest source of income. So, you do the math. 2 + 2 = 4. No way around that.
title: I'm torn on how to rate Fetch...

text: I've had Petplan/Fetch insurance for my beloved dogs for the past 13 years.  At one point we had eight dogs insured  at the same time.  We've been through several types of cancer (both radiation and chemo), diabetes, cushings disease, hypothyroidism,  meningitis, lumbosacral  stenosis,  laryngeal paralysis, allergies, mini strokes, IBD, heart murmur, numerous delicate surgeries, spinal taps, MRIs, CT scans, ER visits and ICU hospitalizations.  Petplan covered it all-even holistic treatments,  There are many other pet insurance providers now than when we first enrolled but I did not look elsewhere when we adopted two young terriers the past year.   Filing claims on the app is easy and reimbursement is fast.   Customer service reps are helpful and efficient-you can talk to a live body!  There is really no reason to look anywhere else.
title: Always there for us

text: I have had my dog insured with Petplan (now Fetch by dodo) since 2017. He has had numerous medical issues that were costly. The first claim I filed was denied because it was determined to be a pre-existing condition. It was indeed a congenital condition but was still denied. I have always been able to choose what deductible and reimbursement percentage I wanted based on how much I  felt I could afford for a premium. This  upcoming year I was told what my premium would be, what my deductible will be, and what my reimbursement percentage would be. I was told it is because I have used a high percentage of the projected amount of my policy or something like that. I  would have paid a higher premium to be able to choose what I would like to do. Buyer beware! I had no idea there was such a stipulation in my policy. My dog is only 6.5 years old and has several chronic diseases. I don't feel I can depend on Fetch to continue to cover him for the rest of his life.
title: I have pet insurance with Fetch

text: I’ve been with Fetch -Petplan for over a decade but for some reason just recently they changed the way they handle claims.  My dog has been very sick and I’ve had to take her to the vet a couple times a week.  Fetch has a convoluted way of handling claims.  One of my claims was broken down into 5 separate claims and when I did the math to see how much I should be reimbursed it was way off from what I was actually paid.  I spoke to a supervisor and they also noticed mistakes so they sent it back to claims.  I had to wait 4 weeks for it to be reimbursed and it still seems wrong.  I called customer support and they also said it’s not clearly explained how they came up with a random number to reimburse me so she downloaded documentation on her end and emailed it to me.  Now I have to download and print out all of the documentation that is not listed in my account online and try to figure out how much I should be reimbursed.  It’s been a total nightmare and not what I really wanted to have been dealing with while caring for a sick elderly dog in the middle of a pandemic.

title: great customer service and good coverage

text:
I have been with Fetch formally Petplan for many years. Overall very happy with my choice of insurance companies. Glad they also went to one deductible vs that crazy deductible per condition. I have had 2 dogs with verty serious conditions and surgeries and have to say I am most grateful to have insurance. Fetch pays for items that other companies do not. I am quick to recommend them to others. Now...the new app when it works is great for submitting claims. I find that "bot" to be totally frustrating and have voiced that on several occasions. It is difficult sometimes to get to a live chat person and if I hang up next thing I get an email with a canned response. Why can't Fetch have a chat portal like all other companies that is user friendly-chewy, amazon, etc etc
2nd complaint/comment....claims take way too long in comparison to others. This has been an issue for a long time so it is not new. 
I would like to give a shout out to Georgia Somerick. She has helped me on several occasions. Her follow up is excellent and she understands what customer service is all about!
title: I have been with Fetch formally Petplan 7+ Years

text:
4 stars: Great
Jan 13, 2022
This is an update review for Petplan…
This is an update review for Petplan NOW CALLED
FETCH i do not know if this company was bought out, or they hired a new MGMT Team, or Finally got their
act together.

But I submitted a claim on 12/26/2021, and was paid 8 days later - lets wait and see if this was a fluke or not.
title: 4 stars

text: Great pet insurance!  The quick turn around on reimbursement was beneficial to us.  Thanks so much!
title: Great pet insurance

text: This is a great company and well worth the investment.  My dog had to have surgery for a torn ACL. I sent the bill and the medical note. I had already met my deductible. They had paid the claim within a week with no questions asked. Super easy and policy very easy to understand.
title: This is a great company and well worth…

text:
Reimbursements are easy . And I got paid in less than 2 weeks. Also got surprised that the probiotics were reimbursed as I thought it would not qualify as reimbursable. 

They also update you on the progress of your reimbursements. 

However, I also got surprised that my deductible was computed after the co-pay. So for a 300$ Deductible , it went to $390 as I have a 30% share. 

But other than that… I am happy with my dealings with this pet insurance company.
title: Happy with Fetch

text: My pup was diagnosed with Cushing’s Disease last March and Fetch has been a huge help. I’d only used it for a claim about 4 yrs ago and that went really well and this time has been just as good an experience. Filing the claims are so easy and the reimbursements come within a couple of days. This will be a lifelong treatment so I appreciate having Fetch.
title: Grateful for Fetch

text: The app is soooo much better than it was with Pet Plan, which was so frustrating.   Quick payment.   No complaints so far!
title: Better App!

text: Overall it is a quick and easy enrolling process. Jason was very patient and explained every question I asked. When I told him that my dog just had his annual check and everything was ok, Jason  reminded me to make sure that the Vet recorded his knee checking result in order to eliminate the 6-month waiting time for any knee issues coverage.
title: Overall it is a quick and easy enrolling process…

text: Great Customer Service. I had to call over the phone to update my address as that's not an option online. Janelle S. was friendly, patient, and communicated steps along the way in updating my address and getting me a new quote/policy that fit my needs. They also went out of their way to go through important updates since I was a previous customer and they have some new features that will make submitting claims a breeze. Already feeling more at ease!
title: Great Customer Service

text: Signing my puppy up was so quick and easy. Jason was great, very patient and he took the time to explain everything covered and the ease of how to submit any claims.
title: Quick and simple

text:
Lindsey Farley took the time to explain all my questions in a professional and kind manner.
that was really appreciated. thank you
title: Friendly and attentive

text: Spoke with Jason, he was extremely helpful. Being a first time dog owner I was nervous about where to start with getting my dog insured. I called Fetch by The Dodo and spoke with Jason and he was excellent. Lincoln is insured and I couldn’t be happier. I recommend Fetch by The Dodo to all dog owners. I was recommended by friends of mine and they raved about how great they are.
title: Spoke with Jason

text: I would 100% recommend this insurance company. I called Fetch (after speaking with several others) with a few questions before making a definitive decision on the company I would be using for my new puppy. My agent, Janelle, made things SUPER clear and easy. She helped me sort through and compare pricing and coverage to build the perfect policy within my budget. She made sure to tell me everything I would need to know: wait times, coverage, red tape, etc. I am so thankful to her and Fetch for helping me protect the future of my puppy (and my wallet)!
title: You Can’t Go Wrong with Fetch or Janelle

text: I have peace of mind knowing that my fur baby is covered is by Fetch insurance.  My insurance agent (Ilona) made the coverage selection process easy, fun, and convenient!  Thank you Ilona for your professionalism, knowledge, and wit.  I appreciate your overview of the Fetch Dodo app!
title: I have peace of mind knowing that my…

text:
This company is terrible. They try to force you to filter all interactions through their app, which is extremely buggy and constantly freezes or crashes. I am unable to open my policy documents from the app, as I simply receive a "file corrupted" error. The live chat feature takes forever to get you to a real person and even then, their answers are clearly scripted and anything more complicated than a yes or no question will get you a "we'll have someone call you" response. Don't expect that call. 

They gave me the runaround on the phone about how to appeal a claim. They actively seek ways to turn down your claims and then are condescending about your "misunderstanding of policy coverage." I'd love to quote my coverage to them,  but I can't open my documents from my app. Funny...

They recently gave me a hard time about not taking my eight week old puppy to the vet in the 60 days prior to coverage, despite the fact that I did not own her until the policy started. I was penalized for being a proactive owner. Another interesting choice by this company. 

They also claimed a condition that was not seen until her adult teeth sprouted was "pre-existing" and refused to cover treatment, which was extremely expensive. When I attempted to gain more information about what they deem a "pre-existing condition," their own website gave me a "not found" error message after being redirected from the aforementioned buggy app. At this point, I have paid hundreds of dollars to a company that has given me zero dollars in return. I would never recommend this company to any owner and will never insure another pet of mine through them again. Hard pass. Save yourself the headaches!
title: This company is terrible

text:
I have just signed up with pet insurance from Fetch. I feel the team is great to work with and helpful. I have reassurance and piece of mind knowing I'm covered if something should happen to my pet. 

Thanks again!!
title: I have just signed up with pet…

text: I called in to get more detailed information before purchasing a policy online. Jason Myers was very efficient and very personable. He even saved me more money on the policy that I did purchase for my fur baby!
title: Customer Service

text: I have spoke with two ladies at Fetch since January 11th and both were very informative and patient.  They answered all of my questions and compared their coverage with another company that I was looking into. I also had the opportunity to deal with Justin, once again very knowledgeable and answered all of my questions, made the changes that I wanted. As having pet insurance is new to me, all three guided me through with the info, advice, and any changes I needed to make to suit me and for my dog.
title: Very knowledgeable agents at Fetch

text:
I have had pet insurance on and off for my two kitties - Sammy & Subban. After a very expensive trip to the vet over Christmas, I thought it was time I get it and keep it.

The one thing that helps Fetch stand out from all the rest is that they cover the exam fee is covered if you've got to take your furbaby in for an emergency. Justin, the rep that I spoke to was great! Very quick and easy process and just felt like I was talking to a friend.

Thank you Fetch!
title: Thank you!

text:
Finally decided to get insurance for Will the cat.  It was so easy to sign up, app easy to use and great customer service.  

Highly recommend this pet insurance.
title: Finally decided to get insurance for…

text: Toni was very friendly,helpful and understanding. She exceeded my expectations and helped me more than I could have imagined. She resolved my isssues very quickly and efficiently.
title: Amazing.Quick.Understanding

text: We signed our puppy up for Fetch as soon as we got her, and it's been wonderful. They have excellent customer service, and it's been such a relief since we ended up having to take her to the vet quite a few times in the first year. Highly recommend Fetch to any pet parent!
title: Awesome coverage and customer service

text: I love Petplan, now Fetch, and I have had it for a few years. Both my dog and cat have Fetch and will continue to have it. Customer Service is excellent.
title: I love Petplan

text: Recently spoke with Stacey about an issue I had with two claims. She was extremely reassuring, professional, and helpful. One of the best experiences I've had with pet insurance!
title: Amazing Customer Service

text: I spoke to a representative today about a claim that had been reviewed and approved.  At the time of the call, I didn't realize that I had misread how the amounts had been reimbursed.  Lindsay took the time to explain to me in detail how the claim had been assessed and reimbursed.  My experience with fetch by The Dodo (formerly Petplan) since 2016 has been nothing but positive.  The representatives are always so caring and helpful.  I would recommend this pet insurance to anyone looking to ensure peace of mind for their pet's well being.
title: I spoke to a representative today about…claim reimbursement.
